Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase snacks

loans.name: Jovana

texts.es:
Jovana es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Jovana es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Jovana vende neumáticos nuevos y usados, actividad que realiza en un local alquilado.
Jovana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos.
Los sueños de Jovana son tener una tienda mas grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Jovana is a member of the Amauta Community Bank. She is a 33-year-old mother of two and lives with her partner. Jovana sells new and used tires at a shop she rents. She is requesting a loan of 2000 soles (approximately $700), which she plans to use to purchase more tires. Jovana's dreams are to have a bigger shop and for her children to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires

loans.name: Haydee Bertha

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Haydee es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Haydee vende ropa a pedido, actividad que realiza en le mercado Nery García sus ventas son al crédito. Además Haydee vende huevo por mayor a las tiendas, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Chincha.
Haydee necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de huevo.
Los sueños de Haydee son que su hija ingrese a la policía y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. She is a 38-year-old mother of three and lives with her partner. Haydee sells clothing by order, an activity she carries out in the Nery García market, and her sales are on credit. Furthermore, Haydee sells eggs wholesale to local stores after acquiring the products from the city of Chincha. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (approximately $350), which she plans to use to invest in purchasing more eggs. Haydee's dreams are to buy a car and for her daughter to join the police.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase eggs to sell wholesale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Josefina es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Josefina junto a su esposo realizan trabajos artesanales en telar como alfombras, pasadizos, para lo cual cuentan con la ayuda de 2 personas, sus ventas los realiza a intermediarios.
Josefina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, tinte.
Josefina sueña con tener una galería y brindar una buena educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. She is a 45-year-old married mother of five children. Josefina, along with her husband, weave artisan handicrafts such as rugs, which they do with the help of two other people. Their sales are carried out through intermediaries. Josefina is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (approximately $350), which she plans to use to purchase wool and dye. Her dream is to have a gallery and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool and dye

loans.name: Nancy Relida

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Nancy es conviviente, tiene 29 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, Nancy vende leña en su casa, producto que compra de los intermediarios.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Nancy son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. She is 29 years old and lives with her partner, and she is expecting her first child. Nancy sells firewood out of her home, and she buys the products from intermediaries. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (approximately $350), which she plans to use to purchase more firewood. Nancy's dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Nieves Vanessa

texts.es:
Nieves es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Nieves es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Nieves tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo que es técnico en computación, además vende golosinas y útiles de escritorio.
Nieves necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una vitrina para dulces.
Los sueños de Nieves son ampliar su negocio y empezar a construir su casa.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. She is a 26-year-old mother of two and lives with her common-law husband. Nieves has Internet stations in her home, and she runs them with the help of her husband, who is a computer technician, and she also sells snacks and office supplies. She is requesting a loan of 1200 soles (approximately $425), which she plans to use to purchase a display case for the candy she sells. Nieves' dreams are to expand her business and start construction of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a display case for the candy she sells.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Rebeca es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Rebeca viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y verduras y de las ferias compra maíz, papa, productos que comercializa en los mercados. Además se dedica a la agricultura de verduras y alfalfa en la comunidad de Totorrilla.
Rebeca necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semilla y para el pago de peones.
El sueño de Rebeca es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a member of the Alondras community bank. Rebeca is married, 50 years old, and has 5 children. Rebeca travels to the different outdoor markets in her region where she sells fruits and vegetables and buys corn and potatoes to commercialize in markets. Additionally, she grows vegetables and alfalfa in the community of Totorrilla. Rebeca needs a loan of 3000 soles that she will invest through the purchase of seeds and use to pay her workers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay workers

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
MYRNA P. is a 48 year-old married woman with 2 children from Brgy. Mabini, Valladolid, Negros Occidental.

Myrna and her husband earn their living through vegetable farming and selling their crop to bulk buyers who go to their farm at harvest time. Vegetable farming is not an easy job and requires the family's full attention and focus. Diligence is required to make sure that the vegetables are pest-free and well cared-for until they are ready for harvest. 

The P. family has so far been blessed with good harvests and Myrna has used most of the money she has borrowed form NWTF-Project Dungganon to buy the materials and tools that she needs to take care of the plants. Thus far, the income from the vegetable farm has been sufficient to support their two daughters' education and the family's basic needs. 

For her 9th loan, Mrs. P. is borrowing PHP 15,000.00, which she plans to use to purchase breeding livestock and  to use as additional capital for her vegetable farm. She hopes to increase the income potential of her family.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Alexandra Maria

texts.es:
Alexandra es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Alexandra es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Alexandra vende golosinas variadas, chupetes, cancha que ella misma prepara, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria en la puerta de un colegio de su barrio.
Alexandra necesita un préstamo de 1100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y leña.
Los sueños de Alexandra es que su hija sea profesional y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. Alexandra, 32, is in a common law marriage and has two children. Alexandra sells various sweets and lollipops that she herself makes. She is a street vendor, and she sells in the doorway of a school in her neighborhood. Alexandra needs a loan for 1,100 PEN to buy sweets and wood. Alexandra’s dreams are that her daughter become a professional and to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets and wood

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Margarita es soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Margarita realiza trabajos en telar como pasadizos, alfombras, actividad que realiza con apoyo de personal dependiendo de la demanda, sus productos lo vende en su casa. 
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas y tintes.
Los sueños de Margarita son construir el segundo piso de su casa y tener una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. Margarita, 40, is single and has one child. Margarita makes loom weavings like rugs. She hires people to help with the work, depending upon the demand. She sells her products from her home. Margarita needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy wool and dye. Margarita’s dreams are to build a second floor on her house and to have a grocery store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool and dye

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Paulina es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Paulina tiene cabinas D. Internet en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hijo, también venD. golosinas y útiles D. escritorio.
Paulina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. golosinas, papeles y audífonos.
Los sueños D. Paulina son tener local propio y casa.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. Paulina, 50, is married and has four children. Paulina has Internet booths in a rented location. She runs the business with help from her son. She also sells sweets and desk supplies. Paulina needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy sweets, paper, and headphones. Paulina’s dream is to have her own place and house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets, paper, and headphones

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer La Rinconada Group

texts.es:
Nuestras socias, pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER LA RINCONADA”, ellas son naturales de la comunidad y distrito de  rinconada Andahuaylillas ubicado en la provincia de Quispicanchis, del departamento de Cusco. 

Nuestras socias tienen entre sus actividades del hogar la crianza de gallinas al por mayor, de cuyes al por mayor, cerdos, también se dedican a la agricultura sembrando y cosechado (maíz, papa, habas); otras socias trabajan en comercio minorista, en el mercado vendiendo comidas, en panaderías, en trasporte, y la socia Justina tiene una tienda de abarrotes, que es precisamente, en esta que se tuvo la última reunión; las socias requieren el préstamo en razón a invertir en sus diferentes actividades y producir mas.  

Nuestras socias agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado, para poder reinvertir y generar mayor ganancia económica, ellas se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer La Rinconada”. They are native to the community and to the district of Rinconada Andahuaylillas, which is located in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

The members are engaged in business activities which include raising animals for wholesale such as poultry, guinea pigs, and swine. They also cultivate and harvest crops such as corn, potatoes, and beans. Other members have retail businesses, sell food in the market, own bakeries, offer transportation services, etc. Justina is a member who sells groceries, just as she had since the last meeting. All of the members plan to invest their loans into their various business activities so that they can increase their production.

The members appreciate and value the loans they have received so that they can reinvest and generate more revenue. They promise to complete repayment of this debt.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinvest into their various businesses

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann M. is a dedicated woman who helps her husband to generate enough income to cover the basic needs of their young family. Mary Ann is 36 years old and married. She has 3 children. She lives on Candelaria St. in the town of San Enrique, Negros Occidental.

For the past five years, Mary Ann M. has operated a small canteen in the San Enrique School where she sells a variety of low-priced but nutritious food, from which she earns Php 7,000.00 per month. 

Now for her 13th loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Ann wants to borrow PHP 9,500.00 to pay the remaining balance on the motorcycle that she and her husband bought on credit. The motorcycle generates income because her husband uses it as a taxi to drive passengers around the town. Mary Ann also intends to use some of the money as working capital for her canteen.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yaoitcha

texts.fr:
Yaoitcha is married and has four children.  She lives with her husband in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin.  Yaoitcha sells fish and charcoal.  She started selling fish when she was younger because her mother also sold fish.  Yaoitcha buys her fish from venders in Porto-Novo markets and her charcoal from a man who delivers it to her home.  She decided to start selling charcoal because of its high demand for cooking and heating.  Yaoitcha sells her products to people in the neighborhood.  

Yaoitcha is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin, in order to increase her sales.  She would like to replenish her supplies of fish and charcoal, which are running low.  In the future, with more financial support, Yaoitcha hopes to expand the variety of goods that she sells.
texts.en:
Yaoitcha is married and has four children. She lives with her husband in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin. Yaoitcha sells fish and charcoal. She started selling fish when she was younger because her mother also sold fish. Yaoitcha buys her fish from vendors in Porto-Novo markets and her charcoal from a man who delivers it to her home. She decided to start selling charcoal because of its high demand for cooking and heating. Yaoitcha sells her products to people in the neighborhood. Yaoitcha is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin, in order to increase her sales. She would like to replenish her supplies of fish and charcoal, which are running low. In the future, with more financial support, Yaoitcha hopes to expand the variety of goods that she sells.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA IRACEL P. C., TIENE 30 AÑOS DE EDAD Y SU FAMILIA ESTA FORMADA POR 6 INTEGRANTES, SU ESPOSO Y 4 HIJOS, VIVE EN UN PEQUEÑO POBLADO LLAMADO OMETEPEC UBICADO EN LA COSTA CHICA DE GUERRERO, ELLA TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE MERCANCIAS DE CONSUMO BASICO EN SU DOMICILIO PARTICULAR, EL CUAL INICIO HACE 6 AÑOS CON LA FINALIDAD DE AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON PARTE DE LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES.

LA SEÑORA NECESITA DE UN FINANCIMIENTO QUE LE AYUDE A  AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO Y TENER MAYOR VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS QUE OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES Y CON ELLO OBTENER MAYORES INGRESOS PARA PODER DARLE UNA MEJOR OPORTUNIDAD DE EDUCACION A SUS HIJOS YA QUE ELLA NO TERMINO LA SECUNDARIA.ES POR ELLO QUE SE ACERCÓ A FUNDACIÓN REALIDAD JUNTO CON 9 PERSONAS PARA FORMAR EL GRUPO QUE LLEVA POR NOMBRE "LAS ESTRELLAS DEL MAR" EN SU MAYORIA SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE COMIDA ECONÓMICA, ROPA Y MERCANCIAS DE CONSUMO BASICO, AL IGUAL QUE IRACEL TODO SU GRUPO ESPERAN PODER EMPRENDER SUS NEGOCIOS PARA MEJORAR EL NIVEL DE VIDA DE SUS FAMILIAS.
texts.en:
Group Name: “Las Estellas del Mar” (The Stars of the Sea) Members: 10 Representative: Iracel P. C. Iracel P. C. is 30 years old and her family includes 6 members – herself, her husband, and 4 children. She lives in a small village called Ometepec located on the small coast of Guerrero. She has a business where she sells general goods from her house. She started this business 6 years ago with the objective of helping her husband with the family’s expenses. She needs financial help to increase the size of her business and to have a bigger variety of products to offer her customers. With that she can increase her income and be able to provide better opportunities in education for her children since she herself did not complete secondary school. It’s because of this that she came to Fundación Realidad (Reality Foundation) with 9 others to form a group that they call “The Stars of the Sea.” The majority of the group sells low-cost food, clothing and general goods. Like Iracel, her entire group hopes to embark on their businesses in order to improve the standard of living of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Mrs. Liezel Camerinl is 37 years old. She is married to Mr. Aaron C. and lives in Central Tabao, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. The couple have been blessed with one child who is now 16 years old.

Liezel used to be a plain housewife who depended on her husband's income to cover their  household expenses, but she noticed that sometimes her husband's income was not enough for their needs. This made her think of ways to help her husband support their family. When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005, she decided to sell fish and "ginamos," a local delicacy made from salted and fermented krill, to the surrounding communities and around the town. It now earns her PHP 13,000 per month. Her earnings have made a big impact on improving her family's quality of life and she has even started saving for her child's college education.

Mrs. C. is now borrowing PHP 17,000 to increase her working capital and enable her to expand her business. This is Liezel C.'s 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Abigael Arielle

texts.en:
Abigael is married and has three daughters. She runs a shop in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin, where she sells cosmetics, suitcases, and jewelry. Abigael also develops photographs when her clients bring their cameras. Abigael has already obtained a loan from Alide, a Kiva field partner in Benin. This loan allowed her to purchase suitcases and other goods in bulk. She was able to visit markets in Togo and Ghana, two countries west of Benin, to buy her goods. 
   
Abigael’s business is going well, but she is seeking another loan to expand her operations. In the future, she would like to start selling fabrics, and to expand her selection of cosmetic products and jewelry. Most people go to the larger city of Cotonou to buy their jewelry, so Abigael sees an opportunity to bring the market to Porto-Novo. Abigael hopes to acquire a loan and to increase her revenues.

loans.use: Fabrics, jewelry, cosmetics, and suitcases

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is married and has three young children, ages eight, five, and one-and-a-half.  She lives with her family in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin, near the center of the city.  

In Porto-Novo, Jacqueline sells rice and beans to passersby on the street. She also sells shoes from her home. Jacqueline buys her products at the Ouando Market, the largest market in Porto-Novo. 

She is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva field partner, to buy beans and peanut oil to use in her dishes. Currently, she has a stock of beans at home and plans to use the loan to replenish her supplies when they run low. In the future, Jacqueline hopes to expand the variety of food that she sells.

loans.use: Peanut oil and beans

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nenita U. is 46 years old, married, and blessed with 4 children, 2 in college, 1 in high school and the youngest in elementary. Nenita is a faithful wife and mother who is determined to improve her family's quality of life through her knowledge and skills in business and with the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon, of which she has been a member of good standing since 2002.

Mrs. U. sells fish in her community and the surrounding communities. This earns her an additional Php 2,000 per month and which helps to pay for some of the family's expenses. She also sells rice to supplement her fish vending revenues.

For her 10th loan, Nenita wants to borrow PHP 11,000. She will to use some of the funds as additional working capital for her business. She is optimistic that this cycle will be fruitful and very progressive.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa P. is 49 years old. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. She lives in Barangay Mabini, Valladolid, Negros Occidental.

Mrs. P. is a natural entrepeneur who has improved her family's plight through her knowledge and skills in handling her business. From the time she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, Luisa has continuously used her loans to improve and expand her "sari-sari" (variety) store, which now earns her about PHP 21,000 per month.

In addition to the sari-sari store, Luisa raises pigs in her backyard and has a 1.2 hectare (~ 3 acre) rice field which is harvested three times a year.

She is now borrowing PHP 14,500 to add to her working capital in the hope that she will generate enough profits to make improvements on her house. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mignonmi Malherne

texts.en:
Mignonmi is married and has two young children. She lives with her family in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin, where she is a hairdresser. She was an apprentice in another salon for four years and then decided to open her own business. At her salon, she cuts and braids hair. She sells a variety of cosmetic products, hairstreaks, shoes, and necklaces. Right outside of her salon, she sells cookies, candy, and other snacks. 

Mignonmi is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva field partner, to replenish her supplies and to better respond to the needs of her clientele. In the future, if she is able to secure more funds, Mignonmi would also like to sell pagnes, which are Beninese fabrics.

loans.use: Hairstreaks and cosmetic products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is 43 years old and has an 8-year-old son. She is a single parent. Consuelo has a business selling cooked food in front of her home in the city of Pucallpa. She frequently sells "juanes," a rice dish typical of the region. 

Consuelo has been working with Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner for eight years and is a member of the "Las Almendras" (The Almonds) communal bank. She invested her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in staple food items. She will do the same with this loan of 1500 soles, investing mostly in items necessary for the production of her "juanes."

Consuelo's loans have helped her to expand her production of cooked foods and have also enabled her to invest in growing fruit on a piece of land that she owns in the countryside. Consuelo grows papaya, plantains and cacao (cocoa). Her goal is eventually to have a soda fountain/restaurant in her home. She also wants to insure that her son gets the best possible education.

loans.use: Staple foods for a restaurant business (rice, sugar, eggs, and oil)

loans.name: Zacharie

texts.fr: Zacharie est marié et est père de trois enfants. Zacharie vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin . Zacharie n'a jamais été à l'école. Zacharie est né des parents pêcheurs et très tôt, il fut initié à la pêche qui est la principale activité de son village natal. Mais depuis quatre ans, Zacharie s'est mis à l'exploitation de sable lagunaire qu’il vend. Zacharie a besoin de moyens financiers pour acheter des matériels de travail. C’est la raison pour laquelle Zacharie sollicite crédit d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Zacharie is married and the father of three children. He lives with his family in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. He never attended school. He was born to parents who fished. And very early on, he was introduced to fishing, which is the principal activity of his native village. But four years ago, Zacharie started making use of lagoon sand, which he sells. He has need of funding to buy equipment and supplies for work. This is why he is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies for his business

loans.name: Placide

texts.en:
Placide K. is married and has two children, ages four and two. She lives with her family in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin, where she sells pans and plates for cooking.  She buys her products at the Ouando Market in Porto-Novo and in Cotonou, a large city about an hour away. Placide sells her goods along the road. 

She has already received a loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin. The loan helped her to expand the variety of her products. Before the loan, she had a smaller operation, selling mainly corn. 

Placide is seeking a second loan to start selling pagnes, beautifully colored Beninese fabrics, and to increase her stock of plates and pans.

loans.use: Plates and pans

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega específicamente en el Mercado Central la señora Albertina L. se dedica a la venta de mecates desde hace 23 años aproximadamente habiéndose destacado en esta actividad ya que es muy visitada por los clientes que hacen uso de estos mecates.

Ella ha solicitado el crédito para dar lugar a la compra de los mecates y de esta manera seguir adelante en su negocio. Su record crediticio con Ceprodel es de 40 créditos a lo largo de su vida en este trabajo y habiendo sido pagados todos los créditos satisfactoriamente por ella misma.
texts.en:
Albertina L. sells rope in the Chinandega department, more specifically, in the Central Market. She has been doing this for approximately 23 years. She stands out in this business. She is frequented often by her customers who use rope. She has asked for a credit to buy the rope. This way she will get ahead in her business. Her credit record with Ceprodel is that she has had 40 loans in her life in this work. She made all of her loan payments satisfactorily by herself.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rope

loans.name: Catalina Sobeyda

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Catalina Sobeyda R. P. con mucho entusiasmo se dedica a laborar en su actividad de venta de artesanías como hamacas, sombreros, canastos, almohadas, entre otros.

Ella es una persona muy alegre y con muchas ganas de desarrollar su negocio y por esto es que ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones del negocio y acaparar más clientes para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Catalina Sobeyda R. P. works enthusiastically in the Chinandega department. She sells handicrafts like hammocks, hats, baskets, pillows, among others. She is a very happy person with a great desire to develop her business. That is why she has come to Ceprodel for a loan. This way she can improve business conditions and get more customers to obtain greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy handicrafts

loans.name: Enith

texts.en:
Enith is 62 years old and has 11 children, all of whom are independent. With the help of some of her children, Enith runs a small tire-repair shop. She also owns a motorcycle taxi and invests in the sale of clothing.

Enith has been working with Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner, for two years and is a member of the "Las Almendras" (The Almonds) communal bank. She used her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in her repair shop.  Enith will use this loan of 1000 soles to invest in shirts, blouses, pants and other clothing to sell.  

Enith's loans from Manuela Ramos have enabled her to maintain her repair shop and purchase her motorcycle taxi.  Enith's goal is to purchase a second taxi. Enith can earn money each day by renting the motorcycle taxis to local drivers. Enith can also use the taxis to help her sons, by providing them with a driving job and a source of income.

loans.use: Shirts, blouses, pants and other clothing for sale

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega especificamente en el Mercado Central la señora Juana N. se dedica arduamente a atender su negocio de venta de ropa siempre muy sonriente siendo esto de mucho gusto para todos sus clientes que le compran a ella.

Hoy en día ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de la ropa y es por este motivo que espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito porque requiere llenar sus estantes y así obtener mejores ingresos en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Chinandega department, more specifically in the Central Market, Juana Noyoa works arduously tending her business selling clothes. She is always smiling, and this pleases her customers who buy from her. She is now asking for a loan to buy clothes. She hopes to be the beneficiary of a loan because she needs to fill her shelves and get greater income from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Kodjo Prosper

texts.fr: Cet homme habite le quartier SOUZA Netimé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé et exerce comme activité la couture. Il est marié avec un enfant à sa charge. il sollicite un prêt à WAGES pour l’achat d’une machine à coudre boutonneuse et une autre surfileuse pour satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle sans cesse croissants.
texts.en:
This is a man who lives in the SOUZA Netimé district on the outskirts of the city of Lomé. His business involves making clothing. He is married and has a child to support. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a sewing machine which can sew buttons or button holes and another machine for overcasting cloth, so as to satisfy his ever-growing needs of his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Fatima del Rosario R. labora en su propia pulpería ubicada en el departamento de Chinandega donde ofrece todo tipo de productos los cuales son comercializados en su sector.

Hoy en día, la señora Fátima atraviesa una necesidad y es la de invertir a lo inmediato en su negocio y es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para solicitar dicho crédito y de esta manera mejorar su condición del negocio y lograr la satisfacción de todos y cada uno de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fatima de Rosario R. works in her own mini market, which is located in the Chinandega department. She offers all types of products that are sold in her area. Fatima now needs a loan to invest immediately in her business. That is why she has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan. This way she will improve the condition of her business and be able to satisfy each one and all of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is married and has four children, two girls and two boys.  Her oldest child is 18 and will soon finish high school.  Epiphanie lives with her family in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin. She has been running a general store for two and a half years. She primarily sells drinks, including sodas, juices, and alcohol.  Ephiphanie also keeps a selection of other goods, including fabric, soap, snacks, and medicines. She buys her products in Porto-Novo and also in Cotonou, a large city that is about an hour away.  

Before opening her store, Epiphanie was a hairdresser. She says that she is now more profitable than before, but that business could still be better.  Ephiphanie is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva field partner in Benin, to increase her sales. With the help of a loan, Epiphanie would like to buy her goods in bulk. This will help her to save money and to expand her operations. Specifically, she hopes to buy more drinks, candy, and rice.

loans.use: Purchase of sweets, drinks, and rice

loans.name: Nelson Ulises

texts.es:
El caballero Nelson C. se ha dedicado desde hace mucho tiempo a su negocio de venta de calzados como lo son sandalias y zapatos tanto para damas, caballeros y niños siendo comercializados en su localidad en el departamento de Chinandega.

Nelson atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y muy sabiamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y a lo inmediato comprar de sus proveedores los calzados para continuar ofreciéndolos en su localidad y así obtener ganancias para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelson Chamorros has been selling footwear like sandals and shoes for women, men, and children for a very long time. He sells from his location in the Chandega department. Nelson needs to invest in his business. He very wisely has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan. He will immediately buy footwear from his providers in order to continue offering the footwear in his locality. That way he will get earnings for the development of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy footwear

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
La señora Silvia S. es propietaria de una panadería en el departamento de Chinandega. A diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana da lugar a la elaboración y venta de pan en su establecimiento elaborando todo tipo de pan como pan simple, dulce, galletas, reposterías y otros derivados.

Con el propósito de elaborar todos estos productos ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito y así comprar la materia prima para continuar elaborando el delicioso pan para la venta en su panadería en el departamento de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia S. is the owner of a bakery in the Chinandega department. Every day, early in the morning she makes and sells all types of breads from her shop - white bread, sweet bread, cookies, pastries, and other variations. She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to buy the ingredients for making and selling this delicious bread in her bakery in the Chinandega department.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de sacs de maïs  à Lomé dans le quartier Amoutivé, cette dame ayant à sa charge 04 enfants sollicite de WAGES un prêt lui permettant d’agrandir son commerce avec l’achat de 20 sacs de maïs et aussi assurer le transport de sa marchandise. Ceci devra  lui permettre de subvenir encore plus aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
A retailer of sacks of corn, this lady has four children to support in Lomé in the Amoutivé district. She is requesting a loan from WAGES allowing her to expand her commerce through purchasing 20 sacks of corn and also to cover the transport of her merchandise. This should enable her to provide for her family even more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Miriam Rosmilda

texts.en:
Miriam is 29 years old. She is married and has two children. Miriam makes wallets, purses, earring stands, dolls and other items by hand.  Her husband is an environmental engineer specializing in forestry.

Miriam has been working with Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner for one year and is a member of the "Las Almendras" (The Almonds) communal bank. She used her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in materials for making her handicrafts. Miriam will use this loan of 1500 soles to purchase materials for making hand-painted earring stands and hand-sewn purses.  

Miriam's loans and her involvement with Manuela Ramos have enabled her to further develop her craft business. Miriam's goal is eventually to have her own workshop and store for her hand-made goods.

loans.use: Materials for making hand-painted earring stands and hand-sewn purses

loans.name: Victoire Emilie

texts.fr: Victoire Emilie est née le 30 Septembre 1960 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Victoire Emilie est mariée et mère d'un seul enfant. Victoire Emilie vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Victoire Emilie a été à l'école mais elle a fini par abandonner les classes au profit de la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine avec l'aide financière de ses parents. Mais, Victoire Emilie laissa cette activité quelques années plus tard  pour vendre des tenues pour hommes et dames. C'est cette activité que Victoire Emilie mène jusqu'à ce jour. Victoire Emilie est à son cinquième crédit avec ALIDé. Victoire Emilie sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Victoire Emilie was born on September 30, 1960 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of only one child. She lives with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She attended school but ended up dropping out in favor of selling kitchen utensils with the financial help of her parents. However, Victoire Emilie left this business a few years later to sell outfits for men and women. It’s a business that she still runs today. She is on her fifth loan with ALIDé. She is requesting this loan to boost her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts for men and some damask fabrics

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur est un tailleur de profession, il confectionne des habits appelés "boubous" pour hommes et dames qu'il revend à ses clients , il a  deux ans d’expérience et a ouvert son atelier qu'il a appelé "CENT DOLLARS" dans le quartier de Bè Kpéhénou N°1 à Lomé. la demande de ses clients est elevée , pour les satisfaire convenablement il doit  acquérir une machine à coudre ainsi que du fil à coudre et divers outils nécessaires à son activité, c'est pour cela qu'il s'adresse à WAGES pour obtenir un crédit. ainsi il pourra améliorer ses prestations de services.
il est marié et a à sa charge deux enfants. c'est avec ce qu'il gagne comme revenu de son activité qu'il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a professional tailor with two years of experience in the Bè Kpéhénou N°1 neighborhood in Lomé and intends to acquire a sewing machine and thread so that he can improve the service he offers. This man is married and raising 2 children. This new equipment will permit him to expand his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine and thread

loans.name: Amie

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier Aguiarkomé à Lomé , elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de bouillie faite à base de farine de maïs , elle y a associé la vente de beignets.les produits nécessaires pour préparer la bouillie sont épuisés,Elle sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 3 sacs de maïs, 1 bidons d'huile et divers produits nécessaires à son activité. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Aguiarkomé neighborhood in Lomé and sells porridge, yams, and fritters. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to consolidate her business. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of yams, maize, and jerrycans of oil

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Marguerite est âgée de 65 ans. Marguerite a fait des études primaires. Mais, c’est des produits alimentaires que Marguerite vend, à savoir : maïs, farine de manioc, tomates fraîches, etc. C’est depuis son jeune âge que Marguerite est dans cette activité. Marguerite est à son septième crédit avec ALIDé. Marguerite a besoin de ce prêt-ci pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Marguerite, 65, attended primary school, but she sells foodstuffs, for example maize, manioc flour, fresh tomatoes, etc. She has been doing this since she was young. Marguerite is on her 7th loan with ALIDé. Marguerite needs this loan to increase her working capital so as to respond efficiently to her clientele's demand.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 6 sacks of 100 kg of maize and 2 big baskets of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La señora Pabla vive con su esposo el señor Héctor, ella percibe su pensión al igual que su marido, ya que son personas de edad mayor.
Pero no solo se conforman con este ingreso, pues son personas muy trabajadoras y que luchan por sus objetivos, ellos tienen un negocio de ropa nueva y usada establecido desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, están tramitando este crédito para la inversión en  compra de mas mercancía para el negocio, y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pabla lives with her husband, Héctor. She and her husband both receive pensions because they are elderly. But, they are not satisfied with this income. They are hard working people who fight for their goals. They have had a new and used clothing business for about ten years. They are asking for this loan to buy more merchandise for their business. This way they will satisfy their customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Felices Group

texts.es:
Maribel F. Ramírez mejor conocida como “Chabe” en su comunidad, de 34 años de edad casada, originaria y vecina de la Atalaya municipio de Tierra Blanca, Veracruz. ella es una mujer trabajadora entusiasta que junto con su esposo el cual se dedica al campo comienzan desde muy temprano su arduo día de trabajo buscando de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida para ellos y para su familia, ella cuenta que desde hace mucho tiempo  le ha gustado trabajar su propio negocio iniciando la venta de pollo y abarrotes por ello  toda la gente de la comunidad y alrededores la tienen considerada como una líder,  cuentan que es seria, responsable de gran corazón y sobre todo con un  carisma que la caracteriza en su localidad. 

           El mayor sueño de Chabe  es reinvertir en  abarrotes, frutas y verduras para que la gente de su localidad no tenga que salir a su municipio a comprar su mandado ya que ella vende de todo en su pequeña tienda y poco a poco quiere surtirse de refacciones para poner una ferretería ya que también vende material ferretero, pero para poder realizar todos estos sueños ella ingreso junto con sus amistades mas allegadas a una micro financiera llamada fundación realidad A.C. en la cual formaron un grupo de 10 integrantes y actualmente se encuentran cursando su segundo ciclo de crédito, de un promedio de $ 3,400 por integrante, ella y sus  compañeros comentan que se sienten muy contentos y orgullosos de poder decir que gracias, a la ayuda que  les ha  otorgado dicha micro financiera han podido incrementar,  sus ingresos y surtir  cada uno en sus diversas actividades que emprende ya que todos son personas trabajadoras, responsables que día a día y de sol a sol buscan mejorar su nivel y calidad  de vida para ellos y en especial para sus hijos. 

          Chabe nos comenta que se siente muy contenta y orgullosa de representar a su grupo el cual se llama Las Gaviotas Felices. Los integrantes de su grupo lo componen 2 hombres y 8 mujeres incluyéndola a ella los cuales son: Patricia F. Malpica (ella tiene una papelería), Ernesta Vázquez Sánchez (ella vende por catalogo), Miguelina A. Rivera (ella vende topper), Román A. Rivera (el vende productos para el hogar), Agustina Martínez M. (ella vende zapatos), Veneranda Hernández Rosas (ella vende comida), Sergio A. Rodríguez (el vende ropa), Noelia Solís Sánchez (ella vende refrescos y dulces), Maria Celestina M. Blas (ella vende comida). 
          La representante del grupo es la persona que se encuentra la primera señora de derecha a izquierda
texts.en:
Maribel F. Ramírez, best known as “Chabe” in her community, is 34-years-old, married, and is a native resident of the Atalaya municipality of Tierra Blanca, Veracruz. She is an enthusiastic and hard-working woman. She and her husband, who works in the fields, begin working hard early every day so they can improve the quality of life for themselves and their family. Chabe says that for a long time she has enjoyed running her own business selling chicken and groceries, so everyone in her community and the surrounding areas considers her a leader. She says she is serious, responsible, big-hearted, and above all, known in her town for her charisma. Chabe’s greatest wish is to reinvest in groceries, fruits, and vegetables so she can sell everything in her little store and the locals won’t have to leave the municipality to shop. Little by little she wants to stock up with parts for a hardware store, since she also sells hardware. To realize her dreams, Chabe joined the A.C. microfinance organization, along with her close friends, and formed a group of 10 members. Currently they are on their second loan cycle, with an average of 3,400 pesos per member. She and her friends say they are very happy and proud to be able to say that, thanks to the help from A.C., they have been able to increase their income, and supply their respective businesses. They are all are hard-working, responsible people, who day after day, from dawn to dusk, are seeking to improve the standard of living and quality of life for themselves, and especially their children. Chabe says that she feels very happy and proud to represent her group, which is called “Las Gaviotas Felices” (The Happy Seagulls). The group consists of 2 men and 8 women, including: Patricia F. Malpica (stationery store), Ernesta Vázquez Sánchez (catalog sales), Miguelina A. Rivera (container sales), Román A. Rivera (household product sales), Agustina Martínez M. (shoe sales), Veneranda Hernández Rosas (food sales), Sergio A. Rodríguez (clothing sales), Noelia Solís Sánchez (soft-drink and candy sales), Maria Celestina M. Blas (food sales). In the picture above, the group’s representative is the woman on the far left.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries, fruits, and legumes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Adjara

texts.fr: Revendeuse d’ignames frites et de beignets à Kodjoviakopé à Lomé depuis 2007, cette dame sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en ignames et sacs de maïs, dans le but de renforcer ses activités. Mariée, elle est mère de deux enfants. Une telle somme la permettra aussi d’agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
A retailer of fried yams and bread fruits at Kodjoviakope in Lome since 2007, this woman is requesting a loan from WAGES for supplies of yams, bags of corn in order to boost her business. She is married and the mother of two children. This amount will also enable her expand her business.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yams and corn

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
la sra. ALBA LUZ V. ORDOÑEZ se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia que esta ubicada en el Benque, Jamastran su pulperia opera bajo el nombre de Pul. "Las Gemelitas" y es de mucha ayuda para su vida.
Doña Alba es madre casada, tiene 4 hijos que los ha sabido mantener muy bien, brindandoles todo el apoyo en sus estudios de los cuales ya van adelante.- La Sra. V. tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad la cual es de buena ayuda por la experiencia con que ella cuenta y eso le ha permitido tener una buena clientela por la amabilidad y actitud que ella demuestra a sus clientes.- y es por ello que le ha podido generar una buena satisfaccion en su familia.
ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder hacer crecer su negocio.
la meta de ella es poder tener un mercadito grande en el cual pueda vender hasta todo tipo de carnes y lacteos.
texts.en:
Alba Luz V. O. sells popular consumer products. She has a mini market, which is located in the Benque, Jamastran. Her mini market is called Las Gemelitas. The mini market is a big help in her life. Alba is married and has four children. She has known how to support them very well. She offered them total support in their education, which they are continuing. Señora V. has had her business for five years. Her experience has been a big help. Her friendliness and the attitude she shows her customers have allowed her to have a good customer base. That is why she has been able to make her family feel satisfied. She needs a loan to buy more merchandise and make her business grow. Her goal is to buy able to have a large market where she can sell all types of meat and dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, churros, bread, beans, shortening, tortillas, rice, sugar, coffee, crackers, and juice

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gladis Maria

texts.en:
Gladis has a business selling shoes, clothing, and bedsheets. She is 49 years old and is married with two adult children. Her husband works in a store that sells home goods.

Gladis has been investing in shoes since she first began working with Kiva's partner Manuela Ramos six years ago. She has since expanded her business and now sometimes sells clothing and bedsheets as well. Gladis will use this loan of 2000 soles to invest entirely in shoes. Her customers have already placed orders.

Gladis is a member of the communal bank "Las Colinas" (The Hills). Gladis's goal is to some day have her own store where she can sell shoes and purses. She would also like to have a small grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing maize to stockpile

loans.name: Hoegnon

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente d’habits, il fait ce commerce depuis 1990 à Bè-Château à Lomé, il s'approvisionne dans le marché local de hedzranawoè. il fait face en ce moment à une rupture de stock, voulant se réapprovisionner, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des chemises de nouveaux modèles et une vingtaine de pantalons . Il est marié et a un enfant à sa charge. Il compte sur son expérience pour mettre à profit ce prêt.
texts.en:
This gentleman has been selling clothing since 1990 in Bè-Château in Lomé and is asking for a loan to stock up by buying shirts and around 20 pairs of pants. He is married and raising one child. He is counting on his experience to allow him to make the most of this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shirts and pants for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase merchandise wholesale for his shop

loans.name: Akprity

texts.fr: Cet homme a ouvert en 1998 un bar dans le quartier d'ahligo à lomé. son stock de boissons a connu une baisse, il veut le rehausser et sollicite par conséquent un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 30 casiers de bières et 20 casiers de sucreries.il est marié et père de 03 enfants. Avec près de 11 ans d'expérience dans ce commerce il sait comment faire fructifier le crédit qu’il aura.
texts.en:
This man opened a bar in 1998 in the Ahligo neighborhood in Lomé. As his inventory has been going low, and wishing to add to his merchandise, he is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 30 crates of beer, and 20 crates of sweet drinks. This gentleman is married and the father of 3 children. With almost 11 years of experience, he knows how to get the most out of his loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of crates of beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Doki

texts.fr: Doki A. est une jeune femme de  28 ans. Elle est domiciliée à Lomé, dans le quartier Dzidzolé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants.  Elle est une petite commerçante des sacs de friperies juste à côté du Commissariat de Dzidzolé. Ce crédit lui permettra de faire des achats des sacs en ballots, ce qui lui permettra de maximiser énormément son bénéfice, et par conséquent, d'assumer le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Doki A. is a young woman of 28. She lives in Lomé, in the Dzidzolé neighborhood. She is married and the mother of 2 children. She is a petty trader who sells used handbags right beside the Commissariat in Dzidzolé. This loan will allow her to buy used bags in bales, which will help enormously in maximizing her profit, and thus will allow her to be responsible for the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying used bags wholesale

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 29-year-old father of one, who runs his carpentry business in the Mukuru slums in Nairobi where he lives. He has requested a first loan of Ksh 20,000 to add stock to his business. He hopes that he will have a successful family with well educated children one day. He describes himself as goal oriented and trustworthy.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a deposit-taking micro-finance company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock to a carpentry business

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has owned and run a small tailoring college and shop for the past ten years. A 32-year-old father of three, Andrew has requested his first loan of Ksh 20,000 in order to buy materials and another machine. He hopes that this loan will help to raise his income and allow him to pay school fees for his children. 

One day, Andrew wants to buy a plot of land and build a house to rent and as a home away from the Mukuru slums where he currently lives and works. Andrew describes himself as visionary, persistent and good at planning.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a deposit-taking micro-finance company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy materials and another machine for a tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Bulk purchase of engine oil

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica has owned and run a small medical clinic for the past seven years. A 40-year-old mother of two, Monica has requested her first loan of Ksh. 40,000 in order to buy more medicine. She hopes that this loan will help to raise her income and allow her to pay school fees for her children. One day, Monica wants to improve the living standards of her family and expand her business. Monica describes herself as hardworking and positive.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to more than 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of medicine

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
L. señora Nancy L. desD. hace 6 años estableció una papelería frente a su casa llamada “Los Pinos”. Este negocio lo puso pensando en el bienestar D. sus hijos ya que así no descuidaría el cuidado D. ellos por que estaría trabajando en su misma casa. ElL. recomendada por otro cliente se da cuenta del apoyo que se ofrece en esta institución y se interesa en pedir un préstamo para surtir su negocio. Como se viene L. temporada D. L. compra D. útiles escolares elL. quiere comprar más mercancía para tener mucha variedad D. artículos escolares y el cliente se vaya satisfecho D. los precios. 
A si elL. tendrá más ingresos en su negocio y así ayudara a su esposo con los gastos familiares y estudios D. sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
6 years ago, Nancy Lucia established a stationary store across the street from her house called "Los Pinos" (The Pines). She created this business thinking about the well being of her children because so that she would not neglect caring for them by working from home. She was recommended by another client who was impressed by the support that this institution offers, so she became interested in requesting a loan to stock up her business. Because the back-to-school season is coming up during which people buy school supplies, she wants to buy more goods to have a variety of school supplies and keep her clients happy with the prices. In this way, Nancy would have more income for her business and be able to help her husband with the family expenses and studies for her small children.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up goods

loans.name: Belkin Anabel

texts.es: la sra. BELKIN ANABEL R. I. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una abarroteria, tiene 4 años de haber iniciado operaciones y su pulperia opera bajo el nombre de pulperia "DAMARY" ubicada en su casa de habitación, ella se ha sabido ganar la clientela por la atención que les brinda y el local es de un ambiente agradable; con los ingresos que le genera su negocio ella ha podido salir adelante brindandole la crianza a su hijo ya que ella es madre soltera, ella manifesto sentirse muy alegre por el apoyo que toda la gente le ha sabido dar. su sueño es ver graduado de la universidad a su hijo que sea un profesional y un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
Señora Belkin Anabel R. I. works selling general goods from a small grocery store that she owns. It has been 4 years since she began operations at her store, which operates under the name "Pulpería Damary" and is located in the same house in which she lives. Señora I. learned to earn her customers by giving them her attention and maintaining a pleasant atmosphere in her store. With the income that her business generates, she is able to continue providing a good life for her son, who relies on her entirely since she is a single mother. She is made to feel very happy by all the help and support that people have provided for her. Her dream is to see her son graduate from university, so that he may grow up to be a good man and become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de refrescos, jugos en caja y lata,

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
la sra. IRMA R. tiene una pulperia ubicada en el Benque Jamastran, la pulperia de la Sra. R. opera bajo el nombre de pulperia "IRMA" tiene 10 años de haber iniciado operaciones a cargo de este negocio el cual en este tiempo le ha ido muy bien y ha podido generar mas desarrollo para su vida.
La Sra. Irma R. es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales los mantiene de sus ganancias que ella obtiene de su pulperia.
Doña Irma, ademas de dedicarse a la pulpería tambien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan hornado mismo que
es vendido en una fabrica de tabacos ya que una de sus hijas labora para esta empresa y ella le ayuda a vender
el pan dentro de la fabrica.
Doña Irma, es primera vez que solicita un credito,  asi ella podra mejorar mucho mas su condición de vida y su negocio.
ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Irma has a small corner shop located in Benque Jamastran, which operates under the name “IRMA.” She started operations 10 years ago and in this time she has been able to create a number of positive developments in her life.

Irma is a single mother with three children who manage the profits she makes from the corner shop.

In addition to running the shop, Irma also makes and sells baked bread at a tobacco factory. One of her daughters works at this factory and she helps her sell the bread.

This is the first time that Irma has requested a loan, so for her it will greatly improve her quality of life and her business.

She requests a loan in order to purchase more merchandise to stock her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her corner shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
la sra. JUANA FRANCISCA V. cuenta con una pulperia ubicada en el Benque Jamastran, la pulperia opera bajo el nombre de pulperia "EMMY"  Doña Juana poco a poco ha sabido ganar su clientela, por la atención que brinda y por las comodidades de pago que da a los empleados de las fabricas,  ella les da crédito y estos le pagan el dia de pago de su respectivo sueldo.
doña Juana, es casada, y de su matrimonio ya solo depende uno de familia al cual le estan brindando la educaión.
su esposo es comerciante individual el cual posee un vehiculo y se dedica a vender de manera ambulante en diferentes comunidades y aldeas del Departamento de El Paraíso y Olancho.
con los ingresos que le genera su negocio ella apoya a su esposo a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar, y cubre a un 100% sus gastos personales.
ella necesita el credito para invertirlo en su negocio, desea tener mas variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Juana’s small grocery store is located in Benque Jamastran under the name “EMMY.” Little by little Juana has been able to increase her customer base by letting her clients who work in factories buy on credit and pay a little every day depending on their respective wages.

Juana is married and from her marriage there is one person who she is helping with their education.

Her husband is a shopkeeper with a vehicle that he uses for traveling to different communities and villages in the department of El Paraíso and Olancho to sell his products. With the income that Juana makes she helps her husband over certain household costs, as well as covering 100% of her personal expenses.

She is requesting a loan to invest into her business in order to offer a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her corner shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Sus 40 años, Andrés ha luchado mucho para tener una buena vida, es soltero y vive en una casa alquilada en su pueblo natal, Huasahuasi. Se dedica al labrado de la tierra, generalmente a la siembra de papas y arvejas, las cuales cada vez que cosecha, las lleva directamente al mercado más importante de la ciudad de Tarma, donde escucha paciente a todos los comerciantes del mercado para decidir por el mejor precio por sus productos, de ese modo viene trabajando durante todos estos años. Andrés ama sus cultivos, pues gracias a las ganancias que le producen paga el alquiler de su vivienda y solventa sus gastos, por lo que no pierde las esperanzas de casarse y formar una familia. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, es uno de los fundadores de su banco comunal y un cliente muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita en esta oportunidad, lo piensa invertir en la compra de 10 sacos de fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
At 40 years old, Andrés has fought hard to have a good life. He is single and lives in a rented house in his hometown of Huasahuasi. He works with the land, most generally planting potatoes and peas, which he brings directly to the market of Tarma every time he harvests them. At this very important market he listens patiently to all of the shopkeepers to decide the best price for his products. Andrés loves cultivation and thanks to the profits he’s made he has been able to pay his rent and for all of his expenses. He has also not lost hope of marrying and having a family. As one of the founders of his village bank, this is his fifth loan with MFP. Andrés is a client who is very punctual with his payments. The loan he requests will be invested in the purchase of 10 sacks of chemical fertilizer to fertilize his potatoes and peas.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Severina

texts.es:
La señora Severina Q. G.  tiene 60 años y estuvo casada pero su esposo viajo hace 15 años a España a trabajar y no sabe de él desde entonces. Tiene 1 hija de 19 años que es madre de una niña de 8 meses, la cual ayuda constantemente con el cuidado de las vacas y por las noches estudia peluquería en la cuidad. La señora Severina vive en la comunidad de Maica Central en Cochabamba, donde tiene 3 vacas, cuya leche utiliza para elaborar queso y venderlo en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Severina se dedica a elaborar queso hace más de 40 años y sus quesos son conocidos en la zona por su excelente calidad.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de Alimento para su ganado (Challa y Soya) que por problemas de sequia el costo de la misma subió mucho y no le alcanza para comprar todo el alimento que sus vacas necesitan. De este modo no tendría problemas de seguir produciendo la misma cantidad de leche que ya produce y la cantidad de queso ni la calidad bajarían. La señora Severina espera poder obtener otro préstamo una vez finalizado este para poder comprar un equipo de peluqueria para que su hija trabaje de peluquera y pueda ganar dinero para poder mejorar su nivel de vida y de su hija de 8 meses.
texts.en:
Mrs. Severina Q. G. is 60 years old and was married but her husband traveled to Spain to work 15 years ago and she has not heard from him since. She has 1 daughter, 19 years old, who is the mother of an 8 month old girl, who studys hairdressing in the city and helps with the constant care of the cows at night. Mrs. Severina lives in Central Maica of the Cochabamba community, where she has 3 cows whose milk is produced and sold in different markets of the city of Cochabamba. Mrs Severina has been selling milk and cheeses, known in the area for its excellent quality, for more than 40 years. The loan will be used to purchase food for her livestock (Chall and soybeans) because the drought increased the cost of the same lot and she does not have enough to buy all the food the cows need. With the loan she would have no problem continuing to produce the same amount of milk that she already produces, nor would the quantity and quality of the cheese decrease. Mrs. Severina hopes to be able to get another loan after this to buy hairdressing equipment for her daughter so that she can work in hairdressing and earn money to improve her standard of living and that of her8 month old daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock feed

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.en:
Angela is 38 years old and is married with three children.  Angela dedicates herself to the sale of beauty products as well as bedspreads, quilts and sheets.  Angela sews the sheets herself.  Her husband works in the timber business.

Angela has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank "Las Colinas" (The Hills).  She plans to invest this loan of 2000 soles in purchasing bedspreads and quilts for sale. 

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Angela has had more capital to invest in her business ventures.  In particular, she has invested a lot in sewing sheets for sale.  Angela's goal is to have her own home-based shop from which she can sell all kinds of goods for the home.

loans.use: To purchase bedspreads and quilts for sale.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia es una mujer muy respeta en su barrio, tiene 44 años de edad y está muy feliz de tener 7 hijos, de los cuales 5 viven con ella. Desde los 20 años se dedica a la labrar la tierra en compañía de su esposo, durante todos estos años han sembrado papas y arvejas. Para ello, todos los días se levanta a las 4 de la madrugada para realizar sus labores domésticas y posteriormente, a las 9 de la mañana, ya está trabajando en sus cultivos. A Basilia le falta dinero para cubrir los gastos del colegio de sus hijos, por ello se ha propuesto incrementar sus siembras con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores. Pero en lo que se refiere a la comercialización, ella es insustituible, pues en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma los compradores son muy astutos; pero la experiencia la ha hecho una buena comerciante y no se deja engañar, más aun, le gusta mucho vender porque se distrae mucho conversando y ofreciendo sus producto a sus clientes. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que está muy emocionada, pues nunca antes ha trabajado con este tipo de créditos. Por otro lado, está muy agradecida con los integrantes de su banco comunal que le dieron la oportunidad de incorporase a su grupo, por lo que hace compromisos de cumplir con todos los acuerdos y pagar mensualmente sus cuotas. Con el monto que ahora solicita comprará 8 bolsas de fertilizantes químicos para sus nuevas chacras de papas.
texts.en:
Basilia is well-respected in her neighborhood. She is 44 years of age and is happy to have her seven children, five of whom live with her. For the past 20 years, she has toiled on her land with the help of her husband. Through all those years, they have planted potatoes and peas. Basilia wakes up at 4am to do the housework and by 9am she is already working in the fields. She lacks the money to pay for her children’s education. With the help of her grown children, she hopes to increase the volume of crops that are planted. When it comes to marketing her products, Basilia is an astute saleswoman because the consumers in Tarma are very knowledgeable. Her experience has helped her become a better trader and she is not easily fooled. She enjoys sales because she likes speaking with her customers and offering them her products.

This is her first loan with MFP. Basilia is very excited because she has never worked with credit before. She is grateful to the members of her communal bank for the opportunity to join their group, so that they can help one another meet their commitments and make their monthly payments. Basilia will use her loan to purchase 8 bags of chemical fertilizers for her new crop of potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Colquiri Group

texts.es: El grupo “Colquiri” Esta representado por el señor Jorge Reymundo y conformado por 13 miembros dentro D. los cuales todos los varones del grupo se dedican al transporte público D. pasajeros y entre las socias mujeres se dedican al comercio D. diferentes productos como la venta D. refrescos, pollo, ropa, comida, y panadería. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero las socias saben como salir adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación entre los socios que trabajan en el transporte público existe gran oferta D. rutas pero la demanda D. pasajeros también es alta por lo que cuentan con ingresos seguros, pero sus herramientas D. trabajo siempre requieren D. mantenimiento es por esta razón que requieren el financiamiento para la reparación D. sus vehículos y a las socias comerciantes para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo. Las socias cuentan con experiencia en créditos solidarios gracias a su experiencia en entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital, pero la institución le da mayores ventajas para poder incrementar mas sus ventas y hacer crecer sus negocios para poder darles a sus familias y a sus hijos una mejor calida D. vida y una mejor educación.
texts.en:
The group "Colquiri" is chaired by Jorge Raymundo and comprises 13 members. All the men in the group offer transportation services to passengers and all the women have stores in which they sell refreshments, chicken, clothes, food and bakery. The members operate in a highly competitive environment, but they know how to get ahead with hard work and dedication.

The members who work in public transportation offer a large variety of routes and have a secure income, as passenger demand is high. But their tools need permanent maintenance, which is why these members require a loan for the repair of their vehicles.

The women, for their part, must increase their working capital. They have some experience in solidarity loans due to their previous membership in organizations similar to Fundación Agricapital. However, they prefer this institution, because it offers them better opportunities to boost their turnover and expand their business. They can thus make sure of a better quality of life for their families and a better education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jhonatan a su corta edad (18), es un joven experto en las técnicas agrícolas. En su familia son 6 hermanos, de los cuales, 2 de ellos viven con sus padres. Desde que obtuvo la mayoría de edad se ha propuesto incrementar sus siembras, pues conoce sus cultivos y planea asegurar sus cosechas con la ayuda de fertilizantes químicos. De lograr cosechar buenos frutos espera comercializarlos en el mercado mayoristas de la ciudad de Tarma y así ir ganando experiencia también como comerciante. Cultivar y cuidar de sus siembras le satisface de sobremanera, puesto que es la única actividad que realiza de muy pequeño y con esta actividad  sus padres le brindaron techo y alimentación. Por ello que hace planes de sembrar numerosas hectáreas de papas y arvejas para obtener las ganancias necesarias para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Jhonatan solicitó que le permitan ingresar a un banco comunal y cuando los miembros del grupo y MFP lo aprobaron, agradeció muy emocionado, recalcando no defraudar a la confianza depositada. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su siembra de papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
At such a young age, Jhonatan (who is 18) is an expert in farming techniques. He has six brothers, two of whom live with his parents. Since becoming an adult, he has proposed to increase his crop plantings because he is knowledgeable and wants to guarantee his harvest with the help of chemical fertilizers. In order to generate good earnings, he plans to sell his crops in the wholesale markets in Tarma where he has gained experience as a trader. Cultivating and caring for his crops gives him great satisfaction because this same line of work enabled his parents to provide him with food and shelter. Therefore, Jhonatan plans to plant several acres of potatoes and peas to generate profits that will improve the quality of life for his family.

Jhonatan has requested to join a communal bank, and was approved by MFP and his fellow group members. They are excited to have him and have emphasized the importance of not violating one another’s trust. Jhonatan will use his loan to purchase chemical fertilizers for his crop of potatoes and peas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis es un joven muy emprendedor de 23 años de edad, es el tercer hermano de 8 y se ha propuesto forjar una carrera. Es soltero, estudia y vive en la casa de sus padres. Desde que adquirió la mayoría de edad, se dedica a sembrar y cultivar las chacras de sus padres para adquirir dinero y pagar sus estudios. Su siembra preferida son las arvejas, porque cosecha de dos a tres veces de una sola siembra y no realiza mucha inversión en abono. Por ello, puede sembrar alternadamente y generar muy buenas ganancias, con las que paga los gastos de la habitación que alquila en la ciudad donde estudia, la cual está situada a tres horas de su pueblo natal. En consecuencia, viaja sólo los fines de semana para estar los sábados, muy temprano, en  sus cultivos, cuyas cosechas termina comercializándolas directamente en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Luis está muy seguro se forjarse airosamente su profesión, y convertirse en un mecánico muy exitoso. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, debido a una invitación se ha incorporado a un banco comunal, donde se siente muy contento por la forma de trabajo y por el apoyo personalizado de la asesora de crédito. El dinero que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de tres bolsas de arvejas para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Luis is a very enterprising young man, who is 23 years old. He is the third brother out of 8, and has decided to build up his career. He is single, he studies, and he lives in his parent's house. Since he became of legal age, he has sowed and cultivated his parent's small farm to earn money and pay for his studies.

His preferred sowing is peas, because he can harvest 2 or 3 times from a single sowing and it doesn't require much investment in fertilizer. With it, he can do alternating sowings and earn very good profits, with which he can pay the expenses of the room that he rents in the city where he studies, which is situated 3 hours from his native village. As a result, on weekends he travels alone very early in the morning on Saturdays to be with his crops, whose harvests he finishes with marketing directly in the wholesale market in the city.
