Luis is confident that he will pursue his profession gracefully, and turn into a very successful engineer. This is his second loan with MFP. Because of an invitation, he became a member of a community bank, where he feels very happy with the form of work and for the personalized support of the loan advisor. The money that he is requesting he is thinking to invest in the purchase of 3 bags of peas for his next sowing.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peas for sowing

loans.name: Rancho Viejo Group

texts.es:
Nancy J. N. es una señora de 23 años de edad, emprendedora y originaria de Rancho Viejo municipio de S. Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca., es representante del grupo Rancho Viejo, su familia la integra su esposo y un niña de 6 años de edad, es casada desde hace siete años y un año despues decidio apoyar economicamente a su familia para mejorar su calidad de vida y se dedicó a elaborar y vender frituras, refrescos, helados y gelatinas.
se le presentó la oportunidad de apoyarse con los microcreditos de Fundacion Realidad, junto con l0 personas mas de la misma comunidad decidieron unirse a la institución y formar el grupo de 11 integrantes mujeres con el nombre de "Rancho Viejo" todas se dedican al comercio como son: venta y elaboración de tamales, tortillas tostadas, venta de colchas por catalogos, venta de calzado por catalogos y venta de cosmeticos.
el recurso del credito será utilizado para adquirir materia prima como son:chicharron listo para preparar,bolsas de plasticos, salsa picante, refrescos, azucar, agua, polvo para preparar gelatina, grenetina y elaborar el producto que comercian, ademas de comprar los productos para la venta por catalogo,todos los productos lo venden de manera ambulante en la población.
esa es la manera en que obtienen ingresos para el bienestar economico de sus familias.
ellas esperan que Fundación Realidad continue apoyandolas con mas credito ya que de ese modo comentan, podrian incrementar sus ingresos y acrecentar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Nancy J. N. is a 23-year-old enterprising woman who comes from the municipality of Rancho Viejo in S. Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca. She is the representative of the Rancho Viejo group. Her family includes her husband and a six-year-old girl. She got married seven years ago and one year later decided to economically support her family in order to improve their quality of life, and she began to make and sell fried food, soft drinks, ice cream, and jelly.

She was given the opportunity to support herself with microloans from the Realidad Foundation, together with 10 other people in her community who decided to join the foundation. They formed a group of 11 women and called themselves the Rancho Viejo group.

They are all involved in commerce in some way: selling and making tamales, tortillas, and tostadas, selling bedding and shoes by catalog, and cosmetic sales.

The loan will be used to buy raw materials like pork rind to fry, plastic bags, salsa picante, soft drinks, sugar, water, gelatin powder, and unflavored gelatin, to make the products they sell. They will also buy products for catalog sales, which they sell door to door. These are the ways they earn income for the economic well-being of their families.

They hope that the Realidad Foundation will continue supporting them with more loans since they can increase their incomes and grow their businesses this way.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and goods

loans.name: San Izaguirre Group

texts.es:
el grupo San I. esta integrado por 3 mujeres las cuales son muy dedicadas a su trabajo, ellas tienen mucha experiencia en las actividades que realizan.
a continuacion se detalla lo que ellas hacen para ganarse la vida:
la sra. Dionicia R. tiene 41 años de edad, ella viven en union libre con el sr. David Ucles, con el tiene 4 hijos, dos ya son de edad mayor y los otros 2 estan en el colegio, Dionicia se dedica al rubro de venta de zapatos para damas y caballeros, este negocio le genera buenos ingresos, ella necesita comprar mercaderia al por mayor para tener mas variedad de zapatos y asi poder cumplir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes. en estos momentos su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion, pero ella quiere poner una tienda grande de venta de zapatos.

la sra. Linda Li C. tiene 34 años y esta casada con el sr. Arnulfo Figueroa con quien tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos en el colegio y los otros dos en la escuela, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia, hace 11 años que tiene este negocio, ella necesita el credito para poder expander mas su negocio, osea hacerlo mas grande y comprar mas mercaderia, asi poder atender mejor a sus clientes.

la sra. Lesly Faviola I. es una joven de 23 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una niña de 2 años, su experiencia como madre a temprana edad la hizo luchar bastante para poder conseguirle sus alimentos a su hija recien nacida. ella comenzo con 1,000.00 lempiras de capital hace un año y ahora le a ido muy bien, empezo comprando zapatos usados y ahora tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual necesita comprar mas zapatos para asi tener mejores ganancias.
las 3 integrantes de este grupo necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The San I. group is made up of 3 women who are very dedicated to their work; they have significant experience in the activities they perform. Following is what these women do to made a living: Mrs. Dionicia R. is 41 years old and lives with Mr David Ucles, with whom she has 4 children. Two of her children are of older age, and the other 2 are in high school. Dionicia is dedicated to the business of selling shoes for men and women, and this business generates good income. She needs to buy additional goods to have more of a variety of shoes and in this way fulfill the requests of her clients. Currently, she runs this business from her house, but she wants to create a large shoe store. Mrs. Linda Li C. is 34 years old and is married to Mr. Arnulfo Figueroa with whom she has 4 children. Two of them are in high school, and the other two in elementary school. She dedicates herself to the sale of popular consumer products and has had a small grocery store for the past 11 years. She needs the loan to be able to further expand her business, in terms of making it bigger and buying more goods to stock it, and therefore be able to serve her clients better. Ms. Lesly Faviola I. is a young woman who is 23 years old and a single mother of a 2-year-old girl. Her experience having a child at a young age has made her fight a lot to be able to attain the supplies necessary for her newborn daughter. She started with 1,000 lempiras of capital a year ago, and now business has been going well, as she has begun to buy used shoes and now has a small store for which she needs to buy more shoes to be able to generate more income. The three members of this group need the loan to be able to succeed and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of: shoes, rice, beans, corn, tortillas, bread, milk, soft drinks, toilet paper, soaps, coffee, churros, comfits, juices, chocolate, pork and chicken, spices, salt, and malts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos tiene 25 años, es un joven muy carismático, quien ama mucho a su madre y a su hermana menor, con quienes vive. Hace 5 años empezó a sembrar flores (gradiolos) en la chacra de su madre y otras veces en terrenos alquilados, pero desde los 18 años siembra arvejas y le va muy bien. Por eso, en aras de incrementar sus ingresos económicos se ha avocado también a la siembra de flores, las cuales son muy rentables en los meses de mayo y octubre, pues llega a sacar más de lo previsto. Dependiendo de cómo se encuentre el mercado, llega a vender la docena a 80 soles, en el caso de cada paquete (como nos muestra en la foto), los vende entre 6 a 7 soles. Entonces prefiere sembrar justo para que cosechar en las fechas de mayor demanda, ya que de ese modo ayuda económicamente a su madre y a su hermana menor en sus estudios, y eso lo llena de mucha satisfacción. Esta es la primera vez que tiene la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo con MFP y es debido a la invitación de un integrante de un banco comunal quien lo recomendó. Por lo que Marcos hace compromisos de adherirse a las reglas y pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita piensa comprar fertilizantes químicos para abonar su chacra de gladiolos y de ese modo tener una buena producción en el mes de octubre.
texts.en:
Marcos is 25 years old and a very charismatic young man. He lives with his mother and his sister whom he loves a lot. Five years ago he started to plant flowers (gladiolus) on his mother’s small farm and other times on rented land. Since he was 18 he has grown peas which has gone very well. Therefore, in the interest of increasing his income, he started to plant flowers. The flowers are very profitable in the months of May and October, and he has earned more than he foresaw. Depending on how the market is, he can sell a dozen flowers for 80 soles. Each package (as he shows us in the photo) sells for 6 or 7 soles. Therefore he prefers to plant so that he harvests in the times of highest demand since he financially helps his mother and his younger sister in her studies, which gives him great satisfaction. This is the first time that he has had the opportunity to access a loan with MFP and it is due to the invitation of a member of a community bank who recommended him. Marcos commits to adhering to the rules and being punctual in all of his payments. With the money he is asking for right now he will buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize the plot of gladiolus flowers and therefore have a good production in the month of October.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertlizers

loans.name: Crisolito Group

texts.es: El grupo “Crisolito” esta representado por el señor Félix y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales se caracterizan por ser un grupo muy unido, solidario y con ganas D. crecer y aprovechar al máximo el apoyo brindado por la Fundación Agrocapital, La mayoría D. las socias del grupo se dedican a la venta D. frutas y verduras el resto D. las socias venden pollos, comida y abarrotes, entre los varones se dedican a la construcción D. viviendas, al trasporte público D. pasajeros y a la confección D. prendas D. vestir para varones. Respecto a la competencia del mercado en el que se mueven hay mucha competencia pero los socios tienen experiencia y saben como salir adelante brindando mejores productos a sus clientes. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. materia prima como semillas, tela e insumos como pollos, repuestos para sus vehículos y para la compra D. herramientas para la construcción. La mayoría D. los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo que conocen los requisitos D. unidad, honestidad y la responsabilidad que se requiere para adquirir el apoyo D. la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The “Crisolito” Group is represented by Sr. Felix and consists of 15 members who are close-knit and support of one another as they seek to increase their earnings and maximize the support provided by Fundación Agrocapital. Most of the group members sell fruits and vegetables while the remaining members have other businesses such as chicken sales, food and groceries, housing construction, public transportation, and men’s clothing sales. The members are aware of the competition that exists in the marketplace and experienced enough to know that they must proviD. their customers with the best products and services in order to succeed.

The members will use their loans to purchase raw materials such as seeds, fabric, supplies for raising chickens, vehicle spare parts, and construction tools. Many of them have previous experience working with solidarity groups and know that they are required to be cooperative, honest, and responsible in order to gain the support of Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Miler

texts.es: Miler de 36 años, es un hombre muy dinámico y de buen carácter. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Desde niño se dedicó al cultivo de papas, arvejas y en menor cantidad, de maíz. Ahora, ya de adulto, obtiene ingresos extras arando las chacras de sus vecinos con los toros de sus suegros, donde le pagan por jornada entre 50 a 60 soles dependiendo del terreno. Y de esas ganancias, a pesar que sus suegros las quieren distribuir en partes iguales, Miler sólo les recibe la tercera parte, pues aprendió a ser agradecido con sus ellos, quienes reiteradamente le brindan su apoyo con sus chacras y sus toros. Por ello, ara todas las chacras de sus vecinos alegremente y en menor tiempo, por lo que tiene mayor disponibilidad para realizar otros trabajos en los cultivos de sus vecinos y cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, donde ha demostrado una responsabilidad digna de imitar, más aun cuando era el tesorero de su banco comunal, al que tiene mucho aprecio, pues todos los integrantes se llevan muy bien y le gusta ahorrar. Por todos estos motivos se siente muy feliz con su grupo y con su trabajo. El dinero que viene solicitado los piensa invertir en la compra de una bolsa de arvejas y 5 sacos de fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
Miler is 36 years old and is a very dynamic man with a good character. He lives in his own house with his wife and their 4 children. Since he was a child, he has grown potatoes, peas, and, in a smaller quantity, corn. Now, as an adult, he earns extra income by plowing his neighbors’ farms with his in-laws’ bulls. The activity earns him between 50 to 60 soles per day, depending on the land. From these earnings, which are distributed evenly between Miler and his in-laws, Miler only receives a third. This is because his in-laws offer him their support with their farms and their bulls. He plows all of his neighbors’ farms happily and quickly, so that he is available to pursue other work with his neighbors’ crops and to cover his household expenses. This is his fifth loan with MFP, where he has demonstrated a dignified responsibility. He is grateful for his community bank, where he was the treasurer. All of the members do very well and enjoy saving. For all of these reasons, he is very happy with his group and with his work. The money that he is requesting will be invested to buy a bag of peas and 5 sacks of chemical fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima K. is 46 years old and married with five children of school age. She runs a café where she provides meals of her national cuisine. She is a cook and finished special cooking school. The café is located in the central local market, which allows her to have many clients, the majority of whom are those making purchases in the market. The business has been generating a stable income for the last seven years.

Now, Rahima is planning to make repairs to her cafe and improve working conditions. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan for the first time. Today she thanks all of those supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To make repairs to her cafe

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter es un joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres, es el tercero de 4 hermanos y se ha propuesto trabajar para apoyar a su madre y hermanos menores. Se dedica a trabajar en las chacras de sus padres y en otras alquiladas, con las miras de mejorar  su calidad de vida. Para él, cultivar es una actividad de mucha responsabilidad, pues debe lograr que sus cosechas sean buenas. Para ello, atiende con dedicación sus cultivos, abonándolos y removiendo la tierra cada vez que se necesario. Pero llegada la cosecha, su mayor dificultad es conseguir el camión para el transporte de los sacos papas, ya que hasta llegar al mercado mayorista de la ciudad le toma una hora y debe pagar 2 soles por cada saco. Por lo demás, está muy contento con su trabajo, ya que las ganancias las comprarte con sus padres y sus hermanos, y también puede adquirir lo necesario para la siguiente campaña de siembra. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, está muy motivado de haberse incorporado a un banco comunal, por lo que asume el compromiso de cumplir todas las reglas y sus pagos. Asimismo, da muestras de agradecimiento a la persona que lo invitó a ser parte de ese grupo, a quien promete no defraudar. El dinero que está solicitando Walter ahora, lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Walter is a young man, who is 21 years old. He lives in his parents’ house and is the third of 4 children. He is working to support his mother and younger siblings. He works in his parents’ fields and in other rented plots of land, with the goal of improving his quality of life. For him, cultivating crops requires a lot of responsibility, so he is dedicated to succeed and to have good harvests. For this, he takes care of his crops with a lot of dedication; he fertilizes his crops and removes the land every time it is necessary. To get to his crops, however, his biggest challenge is to obtain a truck to transport the sacks of potatoes, since getting to the largest market in the city takes him an hour, and he must pay 2 soles for each sack. Other than that, he is very happy with his work, since he shares his earnings with his parents and siblings and also because he can get what he needs for the next harvest. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is very motivated to get involved in his community bank, so he promises to comply with all of the rules and repayments. Also, he is very thankful to the person who invited him to be part of the group, and he has promised this person that he will not default on the loan. With the money that he is requesting, Walter plans to invest in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Tika Llajta Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Tikallajta” esta representado por la señora Margot y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales tienen diferentes actividades como la venta D. bebidas en licorerías, atención en cafés Internet, venta D. cristalería, artesanías, cosméticos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, elaboración D. masitas y al servicio D. limpieza y pintura decorativa para casas. Pese a la existencia D. la competencia en su ambiente laboral los miembros del grupo luchan cada día para poder brindar a sus familias el pan D. cada día. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería para incrementar más sus ventas D. cosméticos, cristalerías abarrotes, insumos para la elaboración D. productos D. mayor calidad, y herramientas que ayuD. a la realización mas eficiente D. sus fuentes D. ingreso que representa el ingreso D. sus hogares a los cuales desean brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. Una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo tiene conocimiento D. la modalidad D. grupos solidarios y saben que se debe tener unidad, honestidad y responsabilidad no solo con la institución sino con los miembros del grupo.
texts.en:
The members of the group “Tika Llajta” are represented by Mrs. Margot, and the group is maD. up of 12 members, who pursue different activities like selling drinks in liquor stores, taking care of Internet cafés, selling glassware, producing handicrafts, selling cosmetics, running grocery stores in the neighborhood, making cakes, and providing cleaning and decorative painting services. Because of the competition in their work setting, the members of the group fight every day to be able to meet the needs of their families. This loan will be used to buy merchandise to increase their sales of cosmetics, glassware, and groceries, to buy supplies to make higher-quality products, and for tools to help them work more efficiently, since these sources of income contribute to their households’ income. They want to offer their families a better quality of life. Most of the members of the group are familiar with solidary groups and know that they must have unity, honesty and responsibility, not only with the institution, but also with the other group members.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for their businesses

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción” que esta ubicado en la cuidad de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, ella estudio educación secundaria do grado), vive en el Barrio Independiente Jr. Ilave.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace muchos años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocios de compra venta de abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va a adquirir bayetas (telas), los compra directamente de los productores al por mayor, también comprará lana por conos de diferentes colores, con los cuales elaboran sus bordados en  bayeta.

Su deseo es poder exportar sus productos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Elena is a partner of the "Inmaculada Concepción" Communal Bank that is located in the city of Juli, in the province of Chucuito, in the district of Puno. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has two years of secondary education. She lives in the Independiente Jr llave neighborhood. She has been working with the women’s rights organization Movimiento Manuela Ramos for many years. Her first loan was S/. 300.00 new soles, which she used as capital to start her businesses of buying and selling grocery items. Currently, she requests an additional loan of S/. 3000.00 new soles. She will use this money to acquire cloth, which she buys directly from wholesale producers. She will also buy wool in various colors so she can make borders around the cloths. She hopes to be able to export her products. She likes the meetings and the facilities in the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cloths and colored acrylic wool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
Anvar M. has a successful business selling home products in his own shop at a market. He started his business about five years ago, after evaluating different business possibilities and deciding this would be the best option and something he would enjoy. He is an internally displaced person who suffered from the Armenian-Azerbaijan war. In 1992, he lost his house and started a new life with a lot of difficulties in the city where he lives now. Anvar purchases his products at very low prices and is then able to resell them for a profit. Because he sells in bulk amounts, he deals with a high inventory turnover rate. Anvar rents a very good location at the market for his business and he has a small amount of competition.

He has requested a loan of 2000 USD to increase his business capital. This loan will give him the ability to purchase more products to sell, enabling him to increase his profit and continue operating a profitable business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Katia Frida

texts.es:
katia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Bellavista”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 18 años de edad, estado civil soltera, sin hijos y tiene estudios de superiores en contabilidad (4to semestre), vive en Barrio Tupac Amaru Jr. Capitán Morante.

Comienza su trabajo con el movimiento Manuela Ramos, es socia nueva y requiere un  préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles,  para la compra de recuerdos en miniaturas, las mismas que venderá en el mercado de Puno.

Su deseo es terminar su carrera y poner su empresa de miniaturas al por mayor.

A ella le gusta la facilidad que dan en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Katia belongs to the Communal Bank “Santa Cruz de Bellavista”, which is located in the Puno District of Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 18 years old, single, and does not have any children. She is currently studying for a degree in accounting (she is in her 4th semester). Katia lives in the neighborhood of Tupac Amaru Jr. Capitán Morante.

She just started working with Manuela Ramos. As a new member, Katia is requesting her first loan of 500 soles to buy miniature souvenirs similar to those sold in the Puno market.

Katia hopes to finish her studies and start a business selling miniature souvenirs wholesale. She enjoys the ease of how the loans were provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase miniature souvenirs

loans.name: Las Apuraditas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Apuraditas” esta dirigida por  el señor Silvestre y conformado por 14 miembros los cuales se dedica a diferentes actividades entre ellas a la venta D. comida, cosméticos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, a la atención en puntos Viva, a la zapatería, chaparía y a la pintura D. interiores D. casas, fumigador D. plagas. A pesar D. la competencia en el mercado los miembros del grupo conocen su negocio y saben como salir adelante ya que D. ello depenD. el ingreso diario que representa el sustento para sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadera, insumos para sus negocios y herramientas D. trabajo. Las socias trabajaron con anterioridad en grupos solidarios por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo en grupos solidarios.
texts.en:
The group “Las Apuraditas” is led by Sr. Silvestre and is composed of 14 members who are engaged in different businesses such as food sales, cosmetics sales, neighborhood grocery stores, calling services through Viva telecommunications, shoe sales, auto body repair, house painting, and pest control. Despite the competition in the marketplace, the members know how to succeed in their businesses because their families’ incomes are dependent on them.

They will use their loans to acquire merchandise, business supplies, and tools for their work. The members have previously worked in solidarity groups and know how they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Hajı

texts.en:
Hajı M. is 56 years old. He is married and has four children. Hajı owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by the grocery store. He is a schoolteacher in the local school but his salary is about 100 USD, which is not enough to cover even the basic needs of his family. 
Hajı, being engaged in this business for nine years, has enlarged his clientele and has many constant customers. He is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to increase his stock. Hajı is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for his store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Bellavista”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 21 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en Barrio Tupac Amaru Av. Simón Bolívar.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de golosinas y tunas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1100.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de chocolates, caramelos, jugos, galletas, yogures, gaseosas, etc., y además comprará tunas, negocio que tiene mayor demanda.

Su deseo es poner una tienda tipo mini market.

A ella le gustan la ganancia de sus ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Virginia belongs to the Community Bank "Santa Cruz de Bellavista," which is located in the Puno District, Puno Province, Puno Department. She is 21 years old, lives with her spouse, is the mother of two children, and has completed high school. She lives in the Tupac Amaru Neighborhood, Simon Bolivar Avenue. She works with the Manuela Ramos movement for two years. Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, money which she used to buy soft drinks and tunas. Now she requires a loan of 1100 nuevos soles, to buy chocolates, caramels, juices, cookies, yogurts, sodas, etc. and also to buy tunas, a business which has a lot of demand. Her hope is to open a mini market type store. She likes the earnings of her savings and the help from the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chocolates, carmels, sodas, cookies, and tunas.

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en: Fazil A. has been dedicated to the business of cattle ranching for the last 11 years. This business requires a lot of dedication because it demands a lot of effort to carry out the breeding. This is also true due to the fact that it requires the strict control of every one of the animals, while at the same time feeding and caring for those that are older. It is necessary to emphasize that through this business. Fazil is able to maintain his family. Now he applied for a 2000 USD loan. The credit will allow him to buy more animals, which he will raise and sell in the market. We believe in his clear vision and with him good luck.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Pastora Valeriana

texts.es:
La señora Pastora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Bellavista”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en Barrio Laykacota Jr. Banchero Rossi.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero con el cual compró pinturas para su taller de planchado. Paralelamente tiene una tienda de abarrotes.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y fideos, para su tienda de abarrotes en Ichu, en Puno tiene su taller de planchado, y además vende golosinas en la puerta de su taller.

Su deseo es poner un mini market  o una tienda de abarrotes grande en Puno.

A ella le gustan la ganancia de sus ahorros y las facilidades en los pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Pastora belongs to the “Santa Cruz de Bellavista” Communal Bank, which is located in the Puno District of Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of 2 children who are elementary school students. She lives in the neighborhood of Laykacota Jr. Banchero Rossi.

Sra. Pastora has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 years. She obtained her initial loan of 500 soles, which was used to paint the shop that houses her ironing business. She also operates a grocery store.

At the moment, Sra. Pastora needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil and noodles for her grocery store in Ichu. At her ironing business in Puno, she also sells candy at the entrance of her store.

Sra. Pastora hopes to open a mini-market or a larger grocery store in Puno. She enjoys the interest she earns from her savings and the ease of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, oil and noodles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es socia, del Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, sin hijos y presenta estudios superiores (Antropología y contabilidad), vive en el Barrio Vallecito.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 08 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de útiles de escritorio. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en su librería, por lo que ella va adquirir lo siguiente:, papel, lapiceros, cuadernos, cartulinas, etc.

Su sueño es tener una familia feliz.

A ella le gusta la colaboración y el apoyo que hay al interior de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Eva is a member of the community bank "3 de Mayo II" which is located in Puno district, Puno province, Department of Puno. She is 27 years old, single with no children, and has higher education (anthropology and accounting). She lives in the Vallecito neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement (a Peruvian feminist organization) for nearly eight years, with an initial loan of 300 PEN, which she used to buy writing supplies.

Now she needs a loan of 3000 PEN, to invest in her bookstore. She will buy the following: paper, pens, notebooks, cards, etc.

Her dream is to have a happy family.

She enjoys the collaboration and the support within her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper, pens, notebooks, cards, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali S. is married with two sons. He works in the agriculture and livestock industry. His strength in work is cultivating livestock. Ali has always been dedicated to managing livestock breeding. Even when he lost his herd of cattle during the Armenian-Azerbaijan war in 1992, he was brave enough to start the same business in his new land. Now Ali needs to invest in his livestock business by purchasing cattle to raise. For this reason he seeks support from AqroInvest by asking for a loan that will allow him to succeed in his business. With your help Ali can get ahead in his business. Lets do our best to help this brave man.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Juana Eliana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “30 D. Agosto”, en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 04 hijos, ella tiene estudios D. educación secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 6 años, su negocio es la venta D. abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, aceite, conservas, etc. Para aumentar el stock en su tienda.

Su deseo es ampliar su tienda para poder sacar profesionales a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros D. Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the community bank "30 D. Agosto" in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 50 years old, married, and is the mother of 4 children. She completed her secondary education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement (a Peruvian feminist organization) for 6 years. Her business is a grocery store; her first loan was 500 PEN, which she used to buy groceries.

Now she needs an additional loan, and has requested 800 PEN, which she will use to buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, preserves, etc. in order to increase the stock in her store.

Her wish is to expand her store to be able to help her children become professionals.

She likes the savings and the meetings at her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, preserves, etc.

loans.name: Subhana

texts.en:
Subhana Q. is dedicated to improving her quality of life and does not scrimp on any efforts to achieve this. Her responsibility as a mother of 3 children is her major driving force. She has been working for 9 years raising young cattle. Subhana built a small stable in her house in order to do this and her earnings represent her long term efforts to care for these animals. This is the main income for her family. As additional income, she uses her salary as a teacher in the local school.

She is very enthusiastic about continuing to raise animals since this will permit her to improve her conditions. Subhana asked for a loan of 2,000 USD to purchase young cattle to expand her business. Let’s support this hard-working and talented woman so that she can attain her goals!

loans.use: To purchase four cows

loans.name: Matlab

texts.en:
Matlab S. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and four children, to whom he is a devoted father. He makes the most of every opportunity, such as when he started selling foodstuffs in the food market. He gives his business constant attention all day long, everyday, and in this way he has attracted customers. His income enables him to contribute to the home finances.

In addition he also works as veterinarian. He is motivated in his work by the need to support the family finances and take care of his children's education in school. Matlab is requesting a loan which he will invest in merchandise for his shop. He wishes to stock it with more products and offer the best products every day.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 42 years old and is married with three children.  She and her husband work together in a bakery that belongs to Sonia's mother.  

Sonia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for six years and is a member of the communal bank "Madres Coraje" (Courageous Mothers).  Sonia invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in her family's bakery and also plans to use this loan of 1,700 soles to purchase ingredients for making various types of bread.  

Sonia has always used her loans to help support the bakery that her mother runs as a family business.  Sonia's goal is to eventually purchase an electric oven for baking (at this time Sonia's family bakes all of their breads in a clay oven using firewood as fuel).

Sonia is pictured here next to a machine for kneading dough.

loans.use: Ingredients for baking breads and cakes at a family-run bakery

loans.name: Jesús Antonia

texts.es:
La señora JESÚS ANTONIA M. A., tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito deL Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA
La empresaria presenta estudios 3ro de secundaria, dejo de estudiar por problemas económicos y apoyar a su familia, tiene 5 hijos de 16, 14, 12, 11 y 1 año quienes depende económicamente de ella.
JESUS  se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios, como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, jugos, gaseosas, carnes, etc, tiene una pequeña tienda instalada en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de productos alimenticios y así empezó con su negocio de la venta de productos alimenticios.
Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor de mas productos alimenticios, en especial productos de primera necesidad, como: arroz (sacos), azúcar (sacos), aceite (cajas), papel higiénico (paquetes), etc 
 JESÚS sueña con ampliar su tienda, para aumentar sus ganancias, para ofrecerle a sus hijos una buena educación y mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús Antonia M. A. is 35 and lives in the Porvenir district of Trujillo Province in the Department of Libertad, Perú. She is a member of the Esperanza del Mañana (Hope for Tomorrow) village bank. This businesswoman studied through her 3rd year of secondary school and then dropped out for economic reasons and to support her family. She has 5 dependent children, aged 16, 14, 12,11, and 1. Jesús earns her living selling food products including: rice, sugar, oils, juices, soft-drinks, meats, etc. She has a small store in her home. She used her first loan, for 300 soles, to buy food products and started her business by selling those. She plans to use this loan, for 800 soles, to buy wholesale food products, particularly staple products like sacks of rice and sugar, crates of oils, packages of toilet paper, etc. Jesús dreams of expanding her store and increasing her income so she provide her children a with good eduction, and improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more food products wholesale, particularly staple products like sacks of rice and sugar, crates of oils, packages of toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Tulagalua

texts.en:
Tulagalua T. is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Sapapalii. She is married and has seven school-age children. To make a living, Tulagalua owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting cocoa for sale. Tulagalua has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Tulagalua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tulagalua has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Tulagalua is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This will be the second loan she has taken out from SPBD. Tulagalua plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Fagalele

texts.en:
Fagalele K. is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Vaiafai. She is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Fagalele owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Fagalele has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Fagalele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fagalele has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Fagalele is now requesting a new loan of 1100 WST, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the second loan she has taken out from SPBD. Fagalele plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and/or expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Carmen Dora

texts.es:
La señora CARMEN DORA S. V. D. C., tiene 56 años, vive en el distrito deL Porvenir  , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6to D. primaria, tiene 5 hijos D. 37, 32, 28, 29 y 22 años quienes no depenD. económicamente D. ella.
CARMEN  se dedica a la venta D. productos alimenticios en la bodega D. su casa, como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, jugos, gaseosas, carnes, etc. 
Su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra D. productos D. vitrinas y balanza electrónica, para la bodega D. su casa.
Este crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor D. mas productos alimenticios, en especial productos D. primera necesidad, como: arroz (sacos), azúcar (sacos), aceite (cajas), papel higiénico (paquetes), y también compra D. una congeladora, para vender helados, y sodas heladas.
CARMEN sueña con ampliar su tienda y colocar una fuente D. soda en su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Dora S. V. D. C. is 56 years old. She lives in Del Porvenir District in Trujillo Province, Department of Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Esperanza del Mañana” (Hope of Tomorrow).

This entrepreneur has a 6th graD. education. She has 5 children (ages 37, 32, 29, 28, and 22) who are all financially independent. Carmen sells food products from the grocery store she operates out of her home, such as rice, sugar, oil, juices, sodas, meat, etc. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy display cabinets and an electronic scale for her business.

Carmen is requesting a new loan of 1500 soles to purchase food products wholesale, especially basic necessities such as sacks of rice, bags of sugar, cases of cooking oil, and packets of toilet paper. She will also buy a freezer so that she can sell ice cream and ice cream sodas. She dreams of expanding her store and installing a soda fountain for her home business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise at wholesale & a freezer

loans.name: Elizabeth Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth es socia del banco comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 1 niño, ella tiene estudios de educación superior incompleta (educación).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir fideos al por mayor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar fideos todas las variedades al por mayor.

Su sueño es poner comprarse una casa y educar a su hijo.

A ella le gusta mucho la unión en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth is a member of the community bank “The 30th of August” in the district of Llave, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 24 years old, is married and has one child. She has studied at the college level but does not have a degree. She has worked with the “Manuela Ramos Movement” for four years. Her first loan was for 300.00 new soles, money that she used to purchase noodles wholesale. Actually, Elizabeth is asking for an additional loan of 3,000.00 new soles. She will use the loan to buy a variety of noodles wholesale. Her dreams are to buy a house and provide an education for her child. She very much appreciates her involvement in the community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale noodles.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Josefina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Siglo XXI”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 54 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 04 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en Barrio San Pedro Cañu Parqui.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles,  el cual utilizó como capital para su negocio de artesanías. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 400.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de bayetas (telas) para la confección de bordados y lanas de varios colores para los bordados, todo por pedidos.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando para salir adelante.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefina belongs to the “Women of the 21st Century” community bank that is located in the Juli district, the Chucuito province, in the department of Puno. She is 54 years old, is married and has four children that have completed their secondary studies. She lives in the community of Barrio San Pedro Cañu Parqui. She has worked for the Manuela Ramos movement for four years. She received her first loan of 300.00 new soles that she used for capital in her crafts business. This time she is asking for a loan of 400.00 new soles that she will use to buy fabric and multicolored wool to use for her embroidery. She makes her art by customer request. Her desire is to continue working in order to continue moving forward. She loves reunions and punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric and colored yarn.

loans.name: Tereise

texts.en:
Tereise T. (0) is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Sapapalii. She is married and has seven school-aged children.

Tereise owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting cocoa for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200 WST a month.

In 2008, Tereise joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Tereise is now requesting a new loan of 1,150 WST which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La señora Justina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en el Barrio Alto Bellavista  Jr. Los Manzanos.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para comprar lanas de alpaca. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra lana de alpaca, lana de alpaca bebe, para elaboración prendas de vestir, chompas, chalinas y accesorios.

Su deseo es seguir con su trabajo y construir su casa.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Ms. Justina belongs to the communal bank, “3 of May II” which is located in the district of Puno, in the province of Puno, in the Department (State) of Puno. She is 38 years old, is married, a mother of 3 children and has completed her primary education. She lives in the neighborhood of Bellavista Jr. Los Manzanos. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 10 years. She obtained an initial loan of PEN 300.00 (Peruvian Nuevo Soles), which she used to buy alpaca wool. Right now she needs a loan of PEN 500.00 to buy alpaca wool and baby alpaca wool for the production of garments, sweaters, shawls and accessories. She wants to continue her work and to construct her own house.

She likes the savings and the punctuality at the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool and baby alpaca wool

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Barco”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito Sector Barco, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, con 3 hijos, y estudios de segundaria completa, vive Chucuito Sector Barco Lote 31.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles,  para la compra  de pescado. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de pescado y también comprara mallas para su negocio de pesca artesanal.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros las reuniones y las charlas
texts.en:
Ms. Yolanda belongs to the communal bank, Santa Cruz de Barco that is located in the District of Chucuito Sector Barco, Province of Chucuito, Department (State) of Puno. She is 35 years old and lives in a civil union with 3 children and has completed her secondary education. She lives in Chucuito Sector Barco Lote 31. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 5 years, with a loan of PEN 300 (Peruvian Nuevo Soles) to buy fish. Right now she is asking for a loan of PEN 800 to buy fish and also mesh for her handcrafted fish business. She wants to continue working. She likes the savings, the meetings and the talks.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and mesh.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina S. (0) is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Fusi Safotulafai. She is married and has four school-aged children. Paulina owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 200 WST a month. In 2009, Paulina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Taufaanuu

texts.en: Taufaanuu L. (0) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Saasaai. She is married and has four school-aged children. Taufaanuu owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 400 WST a month. In 2009, Taufaanuu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Orfelina

texts.es:
La señora Orfelina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla de Oro II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, es madre de 01 hijo y tiene estudios de superiores incompletos (informática), vive en el Barrio Cesar Vallejo Av. Simón Bolívar.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó en comprar de tarjetas para recargas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/ 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de créditos para su locutorio (servicio de llamadas telefonicas), y recargas virtuales para celulares.

Su deseo es ser prestamista y tener mayores ingresos y así poder construir su casa.

A ella le gusta la unión de las socias y se relajan mucho en las reuniones  con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Sra. Orfelina belongs to the Communal Bank “Medalla de Oro II” (Gold Medal II), which is located in the Puno District of Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 22 years old, single, and the mother of one child. Sra. Orfelina studied computer science, but did not complete her degree. She lives in the neighborhood of Cesar Vallejo Av. Simón Bolívar.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 1 year. She used her first loan of 300 soles to buy rechargeable phone cards.

Right now, Sra. Orfelina needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase phone service credits for her call center. She will also buy rechargeable virtual mobile phone cards. Her ambition is to become a moneylender so that she can earn a higher income and be able to build a house. She enjoys being together with the other members and relaxing with her friends.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase phone service credits (for her call center) & rechargeable mobile phone cards

loans.name: Irma Marleni

texts.es:
La señora IRMA MARLENI M. S., tiene 44 años, vive en el distrito deL Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA
La empresaria presenta estudios 5to de secundaria, tiene 4 hijos de 20, 18,16 y 8 años quienes  depende económicamente de ella.
EUIRMA  se dedica a la venta de suelas de zapatos, plantillas, cuero y pegamento para la fabricación de zapatos.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas plantas y pegamentos.
El crédito de 1,500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas plantas, plantillas, cuero, pegamentos y también implementara las tres cabinas de locutorio con los teléfonos , tarifadotes y una computadora.
 IRMA  sueña con ampliar mas su negocio con un locutorio dentro del mismo local donde vende las suelas, plantillas, cuero y pegamentos.
texts.en:
Sra. Irma Marleni M. S. is 44 years old and lives in the district of El Porvenir in Trujillo Province, Deparment of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank Group “Esperanza del Mañana” (Hope of Tomorrow).

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 4 children (ages 20, 18, 16, and 8) who are financially dependent on her. Irma sells soles, insoles, leather and adhesives used for manufacturing shoes. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy soles and adhesives.

Irma’s current loan of 1500 soles will be used to buy more soles, insoles, leather, and adhesives. She also would like to install three phone booths, a tarifador (a device that tracks usage on land line phones), and a computer. She dreams of expanding her business by adding a call center in the same location where she sells shoe manufacturing supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her inventory of shoe manufacturing supplies & purchase equipment to start a call center

loans.name: Pauai

texts.en: Pauai T. (0) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Malae-Faga. She is married and has two school-aged children. Pauai owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 400 WST a month. In 2008, Pauai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Pauai is now requesting a new loan of 750 WST which will again be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “30 D. Agosto”, en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 70 años D. edad, es V. y madre D. 02 hijos, ella pudo estudiar educación primaria incompleta.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 9 años, su negocio es la venta D. abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, aceite, conservas, sal, etc. Para aumentar a su tienda.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the 30 D. Agosto (August 30th) Community Bank in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno, Peru. She is a 70-year-old widow and mother of two children who never finished elementary school. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past nine years. Her first loan for her grocery store was for 500 soles, which she used to purchase more groceries. Currently, she is in need of an additional loan, which is why she has come to request 1,000 soles. She plans to use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, canned goods, salt and other items to better stock her store. Her dream is to keep working, and she enjoys the savings and meetings she gets from her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, canned goods, salt and other grocery items

loans.name: Sonia Chanela

texts.es:
La señora Sonia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Siglo XXI”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios superiores (Técnico en enfermería), vive en Barrio Santa Cruz.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó como capital para su negocio de artesanías. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de bayetas (telas) y lanas de diferentes colores para la elaboración de sus bordados, los cuales los vende a los turistas en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes  y ejercer su profesión.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sonia belongs to the “Mujeres del Siglo XXI” (Women of the 21st Century) Community Bank in the district of Juli, province of Chucuito, department of Puno, Peru. She is 28 years old, has a common-law husband, and is a mother of two children. She has a nursing degree and lives in the neighborhood of Santa Cruz. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past four years and started out with a loan of 300 soles, which she used for her crafts business. Currently she is requesting a loan of 500 soles (approximately $175), which she plans to use to purchase cloths and wools of different colors to make her embroideries that she sells to tourists at the regional markets. Her dream is to set up a grocery store and to practice her profession. Sonia enjoys the savings and meetings she gets as part of her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloths and acrylic wools

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora MARIA ELENA C. L., tiene 43 años, vive en el distrito deL Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5ro de secundaria, tiene 1 hija de 15 años quien depende económicamente de ella.
MARIA  se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios en la bodega de su casa, como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, jugos, gaseosas, carnes, y tambien a la venta de productos de belleza. 
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo inverto en la compra de productos de belleza, como: colonias, talcos, cremas, labiales, sombras, etc.
Este crédito de 1400 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor de mas productos alimenticios, en especial productos de primera necesidad, como: arroz (sacos), azúcar (sacos), aceite (cajas), papel higiénico (paquetes), y también comprara productos de belleza para tener en stock y vender con mayor facilidad y rapidez.
MARIA sueña con ampliar su tienda, para aumentar sus ganancias, para poder otorgarle estudios superiores a su hija.
texts.en:
Maria Elena C. L. is 43 years old and lives in the destrict of El Porvenir, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Esperanza del Manana (Hope for Tomorrow) Community Bank and has a high school education. She has a 15-year-old daughter who depends on her financially. Maria makes a living selling grocery products, such as rice, sugar, oil, juice, soft drinks, meats and also beauty products, in a convenience store out of her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, she invested in the purchase of cosmetic supplies like perfumes, powders, creams, makeup, eyeshadow, etc. With the current loan of 1,400 soles (approximately $500) she is requesting, she plans to invest in the purchase of wholesale grocery supplies, especially products of primary need like rice, sugar, oil and toilet paper, and she also plans to purchase beauty products to increase her stock and so she can sell with more ease and speed. Maria's dream is to expand her store to increase her earnings so she will be able to provide for her daughter's higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale grocery supplies, especially products of primary need like rice, sugar, oil and toilet paper, and also purchase beauty products

loans.name: Moe

texts.en:
Moe G. is a 25 -year-old woman. She lives in the town of Maota. She is married and has 6 young children. To make a living, Moe owns & operates a business venture. The business operates in the food sector. The main purpose of the business is making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from the business. Moe has been engaged in this business for over 2 years. From these activities, Moe earns approximately 400 WST a month.

In 2008, Moe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Moe is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST. The current loan will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Moe plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to the borrower's house.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora MARITZA ELIZABETH D.
texts.en: Sra. Maritza Elizabeth D.

loans.use: Restock her inventory of grocery items & purchase a display case

loans.name: Silvia Soledad

texts.es:
La señora SILVIA SOLEDAD S. D. A. , tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito deL Porvenir  , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA
La empresaria presenta estudios 5to D. secundaria, tiene 3 hijos D. 28, 27 y 25  años quienes no  depenD. económicamente D. ella.
SILVIA  se dedica a la elaboración D. artesanía y manualidades, como: chompas, tapetes, cojines, manteles, aretes, collares, anillos, etc.
El primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra materiales para sus manualidades como: hijos, alambres, piedras, broches, cierres, etc.
Este crédito D. 1,200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra D. mas materiales como: lanas, hilos, perlas, piedras, lentejuelas, algodón, relleno, etc.
 SILVIA  sueña con tener un stand en un centro comercial donD. pueda vender su artesanía y lograr ventas mayores.
texts.en:
Sra. Silvia Soledad S. D. A. is 49 years old and lives in the district of El Porvenir in Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Esperanza del Mañana” (Hope of Tomorrow).

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 3 children (ages 28, 27, and 25) who are financially independent. Silvia is a craftswoman who makes handmaD. items such as sweaters, rugs, cushions, tablecloths, earrings, necklaces, rings, etc. She used her first loan of 300 soles to buy handicraft materials such as wire, stones, pins, locks, etc.

Her current loan of 1200 soles will be used to purchase more materials such as wool, yarn, beads, stones, sequins, cotton, batting, etc. Silvia dreams of having a vending post at the central market where she can sell her handicrafts and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicraft materials

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia N. tiene ya mas de un año dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, esté negocio es la fuente de ingresos familia ya que tiene cuatro hijos que están estudiando y desea que tengan una carera profesional.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía que sus clientes le están pidiendo que venda ya que es la tienda que hay en la colonia. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio y así poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias de negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia N. has been selling groceries for more than a year. This business is the source of her family income. Sra. Lucia has four children who are students and she wants them to have professional careers.

Right now she is lacking the variety of merchandise that her customers are requesting. Her store is the only one that exists in the area. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business and meet the needs of her customers. She plans to repay the loan with the profits from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gasolo

texts.en: Gasolo T. (1054002-03) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Saipipi. She is married and has four school-aged children. Gasolo owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 300 WST a month. In 2008, Gasolo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Gasolo is now requesting a new loan of 1,250 WST which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Lucrecia Angel

texts.es:
La señora LUCRECIA ANGEL O. M. D. A. , tiene 48 años, vive en el distrito D. Moche , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco SEÑOR D. LA PIEDAD II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º D. secundaria, tiene  hijos D. 4 y solo 2 dependen  económicamente D. ella.
LUCRECIA se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en la tienda D. su casa.
El primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invertio en la compra abarrotes, tales como: arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, fideos, jabones, detergentes.
Este crédito D. 1200 nuevos soles lo utilizara para comprar mas productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. y ampliar su tienda.
 LUCRECIA  sueña con tener un bar en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucrecia Angel O. M. D. A. is 48 years old. She lives Peru in the department of La Libertad, province of Trujillo, and district of Moche. She is a member of the Bank Senor D. la Piedad II.

This business woman has an education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has four children, of which only two depend on her financially. Lucrecia sells groceries in her home-based store. Her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles was invested in the purchase of groceries like rice, sugar, soft drinks, cookies, chocolate, beans, soap, and detergent. This loan of 1200 Nuevos Soles will be used to expand her store and buy more food products like rice, sugar, beans, etc.

Lucrecia dreams of having a cafe in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more food products and expand her store

loans.name: Lorena Karina

texts.es:
La señora LORENA KARINA P. M.  , tiene 31 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco SEÑOR DE LA PIEDAD II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene  2hijos de  10 y 4  y que  dependen  económicamente de ella.
LORENA   se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en la tienda de su casa.
Este crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra abarrotes, tales como: arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, fideos, jabones, detergentes.
 LUCRECIA  sueña con tener surtir con mas productos su tienda y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Lorena Karina P. M. is 31 years old and lives in the Moche District of Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the communal bank “Señor de la Piedad II”. This entrepreneur completed her studies through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 2 children (ages 10 and 4) who are financially dependent on her. Lorena sells groceries from a store she operates out of her home. Her loan of 300 soles will be used to buy groceries, such as rice, sugar, sodas, cookies, chocolates, noodles, soaps and detergents. Lorena hopes to restock her store with more products and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, sodas, cookies, chocolates, noodles, soaps and detergents

loans.name: Sonia Yaquelyn

texts.es:
La señora SONIA YAQUELYN B. S., tiene 22 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Mar y Cielo II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad. 
SONIA  se dedica a la venta de ropa de niños, jóvenes y adultos que las lleva a comercializar al pueblo de Hangasmarca.
Este crédito de 300 lo invertirá en la compra de ropa que lo traera de la ciudad de Lima. Comprará prendas de vestir para niños, damas y caballeros.
SONIA, sueña con tener un stand en la ciudad de Trujillo donde pueda vender su ropa.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia Yaquelyn B. S. is 22 years old. She lives in the Esperanza District of Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the communal bank “Mar Y Cielo II” (Sea and Sky II). This entrepreneur completed her studies through the 5th year of secondary school. She has two children (ages 6 and 2).
