Sonia sells clothing for children, teenagers and adults in the town of Hangsamarca. Her loan of 300 soles will be used to buy clothing that will be brought in from Lima. She plans to buy clothes for children, women and men. Sonia dreams of having her own vending booth in Trujillo where she can sell her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for men, women and children

loans.name: Saini

texts.en: Saini V. (1054002-02) is a 64-year-old woman living in the town of Saipipi. She is married and has eight adult children. Saini owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300 WST a month. In 2008, Saini joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Saini is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Maria Modesta

texts.es:
La señora MARIA MODESTA R. M., tiene 45 años, vive en el distrito deL Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6to de primaria, tiene 9 hijos de 27, 25, 24, 22, 19, 18, 16, 14, 1, años, de los cuales 3   depende económicamente de ella.
MARIA  se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, como: queso, quesillo, manjar blanco, natillas, yougurt, los cuales los lleva a vender a Angasmarca y también se dedica a la crianza de conejos, patos, pollos en su casa para venderlos en el mercado mayorista y a sus vecinos. 
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra productos lácteos.
Este crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de conejos y patos.
MARIA sueña con incrementar  su negocio y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Modesta R. M. is 45 years old and lives in the district of El Provenir in Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Esperanza del Mañana” (Hope of Tomorrow). This entrepreneur completed elementary school through 6th grade. She has nine children, three of whom are still financially dependent on her. Maria sells dairy products such as hard cheese, cream cheese, manjar blanco, custard, and yogurt in the town of Angasmarca. She also raises rabbits, ducks and chickens and sells them in the wholesale market or to her neighbors. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy dairy products. She is requesting a new loan of 300 soles to buy rabbits and ducks. She dreams of expanding her business and increasing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rabbits & ducks

loans.name: Elias Jose

texts.es:
El microempresario  Elías José B. F. tiene 36 años de edad es casado con dos hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando en nivel primario y secundario respectivamente, tiene un negocio desde hace 6 años el cual consiste en vender de manera ambulante hot dog y sándwich.

Esta actividad la realiza acompañado de un carretón acondicionado para albergar un tanque de gas y una cocina con la cual elabora su producto. Este negocio le permite tener ganancias ya que muchas personas consumen este producto por ser comida rápida, Este microempresario se moviliza por toda la ciudad de Bluefields ofreciendo su producto principalmente por los colegios de primaria en donde muchos estudiantes compran  en sus recreos los sándwich y hot dog.

Cabe destacar que Elías José ya fue beneficiado con un primer préstamo por parte de Kiva con dicho préstamo pudo comprar mas insumos para la elaboración de sus productos y aprovecho para incrementar sus ventas, sin embargo los gastos del hogar se han incrementado por lo que requiere el financiamiento para comprar más insumos los cuales detallo:

6 Galones de Mayonesa a US 15.00 dólares cada galón, 30 bolsas de Pan sándwich a US 1.20 dólares cada bolsa, 1 tanque de gas a US 13.00 dólares el tanque, 50 libras de salchichas a US 1.90 dólares cada libra, 7 libras de mantequilla a US 2.00 dólares cada libra, 40 libras de mortadela a US 1.80 dólares cada libra, 7 galones de mostaza a US 9.00 dólares cada galón , 6 galones de salsa de tomate a US 13.00 dólares cada galón y 30 bolsas de pan hot dog a US 1.30 dólares cada bolsa.
texts.en:
Micro-entrepreneur Elías José B. F. is 36 and married with two children, one in primary school and the other in secondary school. For the past 6 years he has been in business as a street vendor selling hot dogs and sandwiches. He uses a cart fitted with a gas tank and stove to prepare his food. The business allows Elías José’s to make a profit, as a lot of people eat his food because it’s quick. This micro-entrepreneur travels all around the city of Bluefields offering his product mainly at primary schools, where many of the students buy sandwiches and hot dogs during recess. We should point out that Elías José has already received his first loan from Kiva. He used the money to buy more ingredients to make his food and has enjoyed increased sales. However, household expenses have gone up, so he needs a loan to purchase more ingredients including: 6 gallons of mayonnaise at US$15.00/gallon, 30 loaves of bread at US$1.20/loaf, 1 tank of gas at US$13.00/tank, 50 lb. of sausages at US$1.90/lb., 7 lb. of butter at US$2.00/lb., 40 lb. of mortadella at US$1.80/lb., 7 gallons of mustard at US$9.00/gallon, 6 gallons of tomato sauce at US$13.00/gallon, and 30 bags of hot dog rolls at US$1.30/bag.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mayonaise, sandwich bread, a gas tank, sausages, butter, mortadella, mustard, tomato sauce, and hot dog rolls

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
El señor Patricio Z. ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con FVP y un con Kiva los cuales a pagado puntual mente, con los cuales ha realizado mejoras a su casa. 
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder elaborar la barda lateral de su casa ya que su hijo está creciendo y necesita más seguridad. Pero en este momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo, ya  que se dedica a la construcción de casa. 
Este el ingreso que genera para su familia y con el cual una parte lo utiliza para pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Señor Patricio Z. has so far had four loans with FVP and one with Kiva. These have made it possible for him to make improvements to his house and he has made his payments punctually every month. Now he is seeking a new loan so he can build a side wall on his house since his son is growing up and he needs better security. However, he currently doesn't have the money he needs to buy the materials and he has to deal with making the improvements so it doesn't interfere with his work schedule. He does construction work building houses. This is how her earns his income for his family and part of that will be used to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall on his house.

loans.name: Faifua

texts.en:
Faifua U., a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Saipipi, is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Faifua prepares and sells a variety of food products in the local community. Faifua has been engaged in this business for over a year, earning approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2008, Faifua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD that was used to purchase raw ingredients needed for the business, she is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 3rd loan from SPBD, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Aleida Antonia

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Aleida V. se dedica a laborar en la venta de electrodomésticos y de juguetes que ella misma posee en su establecimiento que es muy visitado por los clientes para adquirir sus productos.

Es de mucha importancia hacer el señalamiento que ella se ha destacado como excelente comerciante en su negocio logrando satisfacer a sus clientes y hoy en día acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los juguetes y los electrodomésticos para así continuar adquiriendo ganancias en el negocio.
texts.en:
Aleida V. sells household appliances and toys in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua. She carries these products in her establishment, which is well frequented by customers buying these products. It is very important to note that she has excelled as a business woman. She has achieved customer satisfaction. She now comes to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy toys and household appliances to continue to get earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy household appliances and toys

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La microempresaria Yesenia del Carmen Alemán Fernández tiene 24 años de edad, es casada con 2 hijos y tiene desde hace 4 años una pulpería en un barrio periférico de esta ciudad de Bluefields. Actualmente su marido se encuentra desempleado y solamente en ocasiones logra trabajar de manera informal, por lo que depende la familia de este negocio.

Cabe mencionar que el sector donde esta ubicada esta pulpería no cuenta con mucha competencia solamente existen dos pulperías y ambas abastecen al sector con la salvedad que solamente esta vende productos cárnicos (Pollo y carne de res) por lo que mantiene sus clientes permanentemente.

Sin embargo aun no cumple con la demanda del sector y necesita crecer en su inventario por lo que está solicitando se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos:

3 Quintales de Arroz americano a US 45.00 cada quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a US 30.00 cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a US 25.00 cada bidón, 50 libras de pollo a US 1.00 cada libra, 2 quintales de frijoles a US 35.00 cada quintal, 50 libras de carne de res a US 1.30 cada libra, 3 cajas de sopa 3 minutos a US 10.00 cada caja y 2 cajas de leche a US 20.00 cada caja.
texts.en:
Yesenia del Carmen Alemán Fernández is a 24 year old entrepreneur. She is married and has two children. For four years she has had a mini market in an outlying district of the city of Bluefields. Her husband is currently unemployed. He only occasionally gets some informal work. Her family depends on her business. There is not much competition in the sector where her mini market is. There are only two stores, and they both supply the area with provisions. Only her store sells meat (chicken and beef), and she therefore keeps her customers permanently. Even so, she does not meet the area’s demands. She needs to increase her inventory. That is why she is asking for a loan for the following products: 3 Quintales (a quintal is equal to 100 pounds) of American rice at US 45.00 per quintal, 2 quintales of sugar at US 30.00 per quintal, 2 drums of oil at US 25.00 per drum, 50 pounds of chicken at US 1.00 per pound, 2 quintales of beans at US 35.00 per quintal, 50 pounds of beef at US 1.30 per pound, 3 boxes of three minute soup at US 10.00 per box and 2 boxes of milk at US 20.00 per box.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, chicken, beans, beef, 3 minute soup, and milk

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Paulina P. tiene ya mas de dos años dedicándose al la venta de ropa usada y  nueva, esté negocio es la fuente de sus ingresos ya que es madre soltera y tiene un hijo que es mayor de edad y el cual tiene ya su propia familia. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero Doña Paulina no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir en juguetes y aparatos electrónicos, ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo que venda esté tipo de artículos. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así poder surtir el negocio sin descapitalizarse.
texts.en:
Paulina P. has been selling used and new clothes for over two years. This business is the source of her income. She is a single mother, and she has one grown child who has his own family. The business needs a greater variety of merchandise. Paulina does not have the money to invest in toys and electrical appliances. Her customers are asking her to sell these types of products. That is why she is asking for a loan to be able to stock her business without stripping it of its assets.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like toys and electrical appliances

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, ubicado en la cuidad de Juliaca, provincia de San Román, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos (solo 1 a su cargo), ella estudio educación secundaria incompleta (2do grado), vive   el Barrio Manco Cápac.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace mas de 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocio de comida rápida.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va adquirir papas, mayonesa, mostaza, aceite, gaseosas, etc.

Su deseo es poner un snack que le genere más ingresos.

A ella le gusta el apoyo que brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Francisca is a partner of the community bank "Corazón de Jesús", located in the city of Juliaca, province of San Román, in the district of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children (only 1 is still under her care). She attended school through her second year of secondary school. She lives in the neighborhood Manco Cápac. She has worked with the women's rights organization Manuela Ramos for more than 3 years. Her first loan was S/. 300.00 new soles, which she used as capital for her fast food business. Currently, she is asking for an additional loan of S/. 1000.00 new soles. She would like to use this sum to purchase food supplies such as potatoes, mayonnaise, mustard, oil, soft drinks, etc. She hopes to create a snack bar that generates higher profits. She likes the support that Manuela Ramos provides.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of potatoes, mayonnaise, mustard, oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Nele

texts.en: Nele T. (0) is a 63-year-old woman living in the town of Faala Palauli. She is married and has thirteen adult children. Nele owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 500 WST a month. In 2008, Nele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Nele is now requesting a new loan of 1,250 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Bellavista”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 42 años de edad, estado civil soltera, y es madre de 02 hijos, y tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (2do grado), vive en Barrio San Antonio.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó como capital para su negocio de venta de condimentos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de pimienta, comino, ajis, ajos, orégano, etc. Rufina también vende comida en su pequeño restaurante.

Su deseo es mejorar su negocio y llevar a otros departamentos inclusive.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Rufina belongs to the Santa Cruz de Bellavista Community Bank, which is located in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 42, single, and she has two children. She completed the second year of high school. She lives in the San Antonio neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her initial loan was for 500 PEN, which she used as capital for her business of selling condiments. She now needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy pepper, cumin, chilies, garlic, and oregano, etc. Rufina also sells food in her small restaurant. Her greatest wish is to improve her business and take it to other departments as well. She likes the savings and the meetings (of her Community Bank).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pepper, cumin, chilies, garlic, and oregano, etc.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo”, ubicado en Centro Poblado de Chijuyo Copapujo del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 50 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 3 hijos, ella es iletrada, vive en de Chijuyo Copapujo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace mas de 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocio de venta de sogas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va adquirir sogas para luego venderlos en las ferias de la zona.  Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor.

Su deseo es dedicarse a la venta de animales y compra de forraje.

A ella le gustan los ahorros las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Gregoria is a member of the community bank “Chijuyo Copapujo”, located in the village of Chijuyo Copapujo, in the Ilave district, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She cannot read and lives in Chijuyo Copapujo.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for more than 2 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which served as capital for her business of selling ropes. Currently she requires an additional loan, which she is requesting for the sum of 500 soles. With this amount, she will buy ropes to later sell in the regional markets. In parallel, she is also breeding small livestock. Her wish is to sell animals and buy forage crops. She likes saving and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ropes

loans.name: María Nieve

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora María Nieve P. se ha dedicado a la venta de café y de pan por medio de su comercialización la cual es llevada a cabo ambulantemente por los diferentes tramos del mercado y en ocasiones se mantiene en un lugar especifico.

Hoy en día ha llegado a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra del pan, la mantequilla y el café para elaborar estos comestibles y ofrecerlos en el mercado siendo esta su forma de ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. María Nieve P. sells coffee and bread in the wholesale market in the city of Managua. As a means of marketing, she travels through the different stretches of the market and sometimes she stays in one specific location. She has come to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of bread, butter, and coffee to make the food and offer it in the market, as this is her way of earning a living and supporting her home.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee and bread

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo”, ubicado en el Centro Poblado D. Chijuyo Copapujo del distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 55 años D. edad, estado civil casada y madre D. 6 hijos, solo uno esta con ella. Juana estudió primaria incompleta (2do grado), vive en centro poblado D.  Chijuyo Copapujo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 02 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que lo utilizó como capital para la elaboración D. sogas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va adquirir cabuya en Desaguadero luego fabrica sogas que los venD. en las ferias D. ganadería.

Su deseo es comprarse  chanchos para engorD. y dedicarse a ese negoico que genera mayores ingresos.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is a member of the community bank “Chijuyo Copapujo”, located in the village of Chijuyo Copapujo, district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children, only one of which lives with her. Juana studied in school until 2nd graD., and lives in the village of Chijuyo Copapujo.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 2 years. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used for the production of ropes. Currently, she requires an additional loan, which she is requesting for the sum of 500 soles. With this amount, she will purchase cabuya (a natural fiber used to make ropes) in Desaguadero. Then she will make ropes, which she will sell in the cattle markets. Her wish is to buy herself pigs in order to fatten them and sell them in order to generate higher income. She likes the easiness of the loans, and saving.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cabuya (material to make ropes).

loans.name: Juan Israel

texts.es:
El señor Juan A. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de pulpería donde atiende ofreciendo todo tipo de productos tales como comestibles, productos personales y productos en general.

Se mantiene todo el tiempo atendiendo la pulpería y ha logrado acaparar varios clientes que requieren ser atendidos muy bien. El señor A. solicita el crédito para la compra de los productos tales como las gaseosas, detergentes, medicamentos y tarjetas de celulares. Por esta razón es que solicitó el crédito en Ceprodel para suplir los estantes del negocio y así seguir atendiendo su pulpería el cual está ubicada en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan A. works very hard at his grocery store, where he offers all kinds of products like food, personal products, and general products. He spends all of his time taking care of his grocery store, and he has succeeded in serving many clients who need to be well taken care of. Mr. A. is requesting the loan to buy products like sodas, detergents, medicines and calling cards. He is requesting the loan from Ceprodel to supply his store, so that he can continue taking care of his grocery store, which is located in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Mery Olinda

texts.es:
La señora Mery es socia del banco comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente con 02 dos hijos, ella pudo estudiar educación secundaria completa, vive en el Jr. Chucuito.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir gaseosas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar  gaseosas de todo marca y tamaño.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las facilidades de pago.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mery is a member of the August 30 (“30 de Agosto”) Community Bank, which is in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 30 years old and lives with her partner and 2 children. She has completed secondary school, and she lives in Jr. Chucuito. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years. She sells groceries. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used as capital to buy sodas. At present, she needs another loan, so she is requesting 500 nuevos soles. The loan will be used to buy different brands and sizes of sodas. Her dream is to have a grocery store. She likes the meetings and ease of repaying.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sodas

loans.name: Braxides Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 07 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria incompleta, (3er grado), vive en el Barrio Chacarilla Alta.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles,  para la preparación de salteñas (alimento de la zona. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de pan e insumos para la preparación de salteñas (alimento de la zona). Ella también tiene un puesto de venta de chifles solo los días de ferias.

Su deseo es seguir con su trabajo para darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gusta la cuenta interna (ahorros) y la forma de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maruja belongs to the May 3 II (“3 de Mayo II”) Community Bank, which is located in the district of Puno, in the province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 37 years old, lives with her partner, is the mother of 7 children, and has completed the 3rd year of primary school. She lives in the Chacarilla Alta neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for many years. She used an early loan of 200 nuevos soles to make salteñas (a regional food, similar to an empanada). At present, she needs a loan for 500 nuevos soles to buy bread and supplies to make salteñas. She also has a stand, where she sells chifles (fried green plantains) only at fairs. Her dream is to continue her work so that she can provide an education to her children. She likes taking account of her finances (savings), and she enjoys her work.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread and supplies to make salteñas, a regional food similar to an empanada

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La señora Asunta es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo”, ubicado en el Centro Poblado D. Chijuyo Copapujo del distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 61 años D. edad, estado civil casada y madre D. 5 hijos, tiene estudios primaria incompleta (2do grado), vive en Chijuyo Copapujo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi medio año, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que lo utilizó como capital para la fabricación D. sogas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va adquirir cabuya en Desaguadero para después fabricar sogas que las venD. en las ferias D. ganadería.  Ella se encuentra un poco delicada y por eso no se encuentra trabajando.  Paralelamente se dedica a la cría D. ganado.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando ya que esta acostumbrada a su negocio.

A ella le gusta el apoyo que dan a las mujeres por parte D. Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Sra. Asunta is a member of the Communal Bank “Chijuyo Copapujo”, which is located in central Chijuyo Copapujo in the District of Illave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 61 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. She has a second graD. education. Sra. Asunta lives in Chijuyo Copapujo.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for almost 6 months. Her first loan of 500 soles was used as capital for manufacturing ropes.

She is requesting another loan in the amount of 500 soles in order to buy cabuya (fibers obtained from agave plants) from the town of Desaguadero in order to make ropes to be sold at livestock fairs. Sra. Asunta is a bit frail and not working at the moment. When she is active, she is also engaged in raising cattle.

She desires to continue working so that she can get accustomed to running a business. Sra. Asunta enjoys the support of the other women who have joined Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making rope

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Mrs. Lorna E. is a 49-year-old widow from Binalbagan, Negros Occidental who has two school-age children. Lorna has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1994. Five years ago, she started selling cigarettes on a wholesale basis to help sustain her family's daily expenses and to fund her children's education. The PHP 10,000 loan that she is borrowing for her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon will be used as additional working capital so that she can buy more stock to sell and continue supporting her single-parent family. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her business

loans.name: Sergio J Dolores

texts.es:
El señor Sergio J Dolores está muy agradecido por su gran ayuda con el anterior crédito el cual pudo reparar el techo de su casa. 
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo pero ahora necesita herramienta nueva y de mejor calidad para su trabajo ya que se dedica a la construcción y le está haciendo falta ya que tiene varios trabajos para realizar y por falta de herramienta no ha podido terminarlos, también desea darles a dos personas trabajo. Es por eso que solicita su cooperación para este nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Sergio J Dolores is very grateful for the assistance of his previous loan, which was used to repair the roof of his house.

He is now requesting a loan to purchase new tools to help him improve the quality of his work. Sr. Sergio is in the construction business and has several projects that are pending, but he lacks the necessary tools to complete them. He also wants to provide work for two employees. This is why he is seeking your cooperation with this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: Jhon Robert

texts.es:
Nuestro socio es el Sr. Jhon, el vive en la av. Collasuyo O-18, perteneciente  ala ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, él es docente en la comunidad de  huarocondo situado en el distrito de Anta, nuestro socio viaja todos los días muy temprano por la mañana hasta Anta que está a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco, y retorna todos los días a su casa en Cusco, trabaja de lunes a viernes como profesor de primaria, nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en algo personal, que él prefiere mantenerlo en secreto hasta que se concrete su sueño.

Nuestro socio agradece el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Jhon lives on Av. Collasuyo O-18, which is in the city of Cusco. He is 41 years old, married, and a teacher in the community of Huarocondo, which is in the Anta District. Every day he leaves early in the morning because Anta is 1 hour away, and then returns to his home in Cusco. He works Monday through Friday as an elementary school teacher. He is requesting a personal loan and prefers to keep his reasons secret until his dream is realized. He appreciates the support provided through this medium and is committed to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Maria Clariza

texts.es:
La socia se llama Clariza, ella es natural de Cusco y vive actualmente en la av. Ucchullo grande Q-18, a 15 minutos de la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 38 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos ella no es casada pero convive con su pareja actual, la socia es docente en la comunidad de Pucyura en el distrito de Anta.  Nuestra socia desea invertir su dinerito en la compra de algunos electrodomésticos en su hogar, ella cubrirá su s cuotas con el pago mensual de su trabajo como docente.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Clariza is a native of Cusco, and currently lives 15 minutes outside of that city. Clariza is 38 years old and has 2 children. She is not married but lives with her current partner. She is a teacher in the Pucyura community in the Anta district. She wishes to invest her small loan in the purchase of appliances for her home.She will make her loan payments with the monthly salary she earns in her work as a teacher. Clariza appreciates and values the loan made to her and she commits to make her repayments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in small home appliances

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora María V. tiene ya más de diez años dedicándose a oficio de costurera. 
Este negocio es familiar en el trabaja su esposo y una de sus hijas es el ingreso que tiene para poder salir adelante. 
Doña María ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales pago pagado puntual mente, en esté momento esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar materia prima (Telas, Hilos, Botones, etcétera) ya que le están solicitando de varias escuela que elabore los uniformes, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material. Es por eso que solicita un crédito para poder cumplir con el compromiso que tiene, y planea pagarlo con los ingresos que genera su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. María V. has over 10 years of experience as a seamstress. She has a family business, since it provides work for her husband and one of her daughters so that they can earn money to get ahead.

Doña María already has 3 previous loans with FVP that were repaid on time. At the moment, she is requesting a loan to buy materials (fabric, thread, buttons, etc.) for making school uniforms since she does not have necessary funds. With each request there is a provision to complete the loan commitment, so she plans to make her payments using the earnings generated from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for school uniforms

loans.name: Rocio Mayveli

texts.es:
La socia Rocio, es natural del Cusco, ella vive en el barrio de San Sebastián, en la Urb. San Luis A-1, a 15 minutos del centro de la ciudad.

La socia tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y vive sola, ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, ella estudió esta carrera técnica durante 3 años, nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para comprar hilos, telas y terminar de pagar una maquina que adquirió el año pasado. 

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rocio, a partner of the Asociación Arariwa, is a native of Cusco. She lives in the San Sebastién neighborhood, 15 minutes from the center of the city. Our partner is 36 years old and single; she lives alone. She works crafting handmade clothing. She studied this career for 3 years. Our partner needs the loan in order to buy thread and cloth and to complete her payments on the sewing machine she bought last year. Rocio appreciates the loan and commits to repaying the loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia radica en la ciudad del Cusco casi toda su vida, ella vive en el barrio collasuyo en la letra E-10.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad,  es conviviente, y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración de su pequeño restaurante, situado en su misma casa, ella prepara menús y extras, ella es una excelente cocinera y disfruta lo que hace, nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para poder implementar un poco mas su pequeño restaurante.

Ella agradece el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner of the Asociación Arariwa has lived in Cusco all her life. She lives in the Collasuyo neighborhood. Our partner is 33 years old, lives with her partner and alternates her household activities with the running of her small restaurant, which is located right in her home. She prepares 2 and 3 course meals and additional "extra" dishes. She is an excellent cook and enjoys her work. Our partner needs this loan in order to better equip her little restaurant. She appreciates the support she receives from Kiva and the Asociación Arariwa and commits to meet her repayment responsibilities on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Equip her restaurant

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Don Agustin de 39 años de edad es soltero, tiene un niño en edad escolar, trabaja en el MINSA del Rama desde hace 15 años como auxiliar de enfermeria; esta solicitando su 5to credito para mejorar su vivienda embaldosando el piso de su casa que mide 7 x 7 mts, el que actualmente es de tierra y asi poder brindar condiciones a su familia, pues con la temporada de invierno se le hace lodo en la entrada de la casa, ademas si el credito se lo permite desea hacerle el porche a su casita y asi poco a poco obtener las condiciones basicas de vida para su familia. Cabe señalar que los creditos anteriores que ha obtenido en nuestra institucion los ha utilizado para mejorar su vivienda.  El mayor sueño de don Agustin es poder tener su vivienda bonita pues es el patrimonio que dejara a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Agustin is 39 years of age and single. He has a son who is of school-age, and he has worked for the past 15 years in the MINSA de Rama as a hospital assistant. He is requesting his fifth loan to help him improve his home by putting tile over the floor, which measures 7x7 meters, and is currently made of dirt. By tiling the floor, he would be able to offer better living conditions to his family; as it is now, the winter weather turns the floor to mud at the entrance to his home. In addition to this, if the loan allows, he would like to make a small porch for his house. In this manner, bit by bit adding to his house, he hopes to acquire the basic amenities of a proper home for his family. It should be noted that Don Agustin has used the previous loans granted to him in order to improve his home, as he has stated. Don Agustin's greatest wish is to be able to have a completed, beautiful home which his family may in time inherit from him.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Embaldosar y hacer porche

loans.name: Julio Adrián

texts.es:
El joven Julio Adrián D. H. tiene ya mas D. trece años dedicando se al oficio D. chofer D. un taxi. 
Este negocio es la fuente D. ingresos para su familia ya que esta bajos su responsabilidad sus padres que son personas ya mayores D. edad.
El está solicitando un préstamo ya que desea contar con otro vehiculo para generar más ingresos y fuentes D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Julio Adrián D. H. has over thirteen years experience working as a taxi driver. This business is the source of income for his family, but it is not enough since he is also responsible for his parents who are getting older in age.

He is requesting a loan so that he can acquire another vehicle to generate more income and handle more work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase another vehicle to generate more business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
L. socia Gladis, radica en L. ciudad del Cusco, en el barrio D. mariscal gamarra A-3, en el distrito D. huanchac.

Nuestra socia tiene 57 años D. edad, es soltera y es técnica en confección y modas, nuestra socia tiene su tienda D. modas, preparadas por elL. misma,  en su casa taller, L. socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en L. compra D. telas para elaborar sus ternos y vestidos para damas y caballeros, elL. trabaja con este negocio 35 años.

L. socia agradece y valora el préstamo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The businesswoman Gladis is from the Huamchac district of the Mariscal Gamarra A-3 community in the city of Cusco. She is 57 years old, single, and is trained in tailoring and fashion. She has a high fashion store of clothing she has maD. in her workshop at home. She is asking for the loan to be able to purchase fabric in order to make her suits and dresses for both women and men. She has been working in this business for 35 years. She appreciates and values the loan provided and promises to pay her debt within the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Material for Sewing and Tailoring

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
La señorita Jacqueline S. actual mente está terminada su carrera profesional como Licenciada en ciencias de la comunicación. 
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo ya que le esta haciendo falta pagar la titilación de la carrera pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder liquidar ya su ciclo escolar.  
Jacqueline esta trabajando como conductora de una estación de radio, con los ingresos que genera de su empleo, planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Miss Jacqueline S. is currently completing her professional degree in Communications Science. This is why she is requesting this loan, since she needs to pay the fees to receive her degree, but she doesn't have enough money on hand to pay for her diploma. Jacqueline is working as a deejay for a local radio station, and plans to use that income to pay off this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for diploma in Communications Science

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es:
La señora Imelda R. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudad mucho a que su negocio creciera y tuviera mas clientes.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder surtir su negocio de ropa de temporada de verano y de otoño ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir  y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio.
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que es viuda y tiene bajo su responsabilidad de hijo el cual esta estudiando.
Doña Imelda cuenta también con un ingreso extra de una pensión que recibe de su esposo y con el cual planea pagar este otro crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Imelda R. is very grateful for her previous loan which helped her business grow and attract more customers.

She is requesting a new loan to restock her business with seasonal clothing for summer and fall. Right now, she does not have the available funds and does not want to take money out of her business. Her work provides income for her family, since she is a widow and is responsible for her son who is currently studying. Doña Imelda also receives extra income from her late husband’s pension, which she will use to repay this loan.

Click HERE to Doña Imelda's previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
Federico es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, de 14 y 10 años de edad en el sector Alto Perú, distrito de Pimentel, ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica eventualmente a la pesca artesanal, pero esta actividad no se ejerce durante todo el año debido a las épocas de veda, motivo por el cual tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donde vende productos de consumo diario (arroz, aceite, azúcar, etc.), así como verduras, frutas y abarrotes; este negocio es la principal fuente de ingreso económico de la familia y también sirve para solventar la educación de sus dos menores hijos que asisten a una escuela local.

Con el afán de ampliar su negocio con la venta de balones de gas para uso doméstico, se ha visto en la necesidad de solictar por primera vez un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.

Esta ampliación le permitirá seguir sustentando a su familia y, en especial, asegurar la educación de sus hijos para brindarles un mejor futuro. El goza de buenas referencias con sus vecinos los cuales lo consideran una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Federico is 35 years old, married, and the father of two children (ages 14 and 10). He and his family live in the area of Alto Perú, Pimentel District, which is located 25 minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo.

Federico earns his living as a fisherman, but he cannot fish the entire year because of the closed seasons. This is why he also has a small business in his home selling everyday household products (rice, oil, sugar, etc.) as well as vegetables, fruits, and groceries. His business is the main source of income for his family and also provides for the education of his two young children who attend a local school.

In order to expand his business, he will sell containers of gas for home use. Federico is requesting his first loan of 1500 soles so that he can do this. The extra capital will allow him to support his family and ensure his children’s education for a better future. His neighbors have provided good references indicating Federico is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic consumer products for resale

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.es:
Flor tiene 50 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres en el Sector Las Vegas, en la carretera a Pomalca, una pequeña ciudad ubicada a 15 minutos de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 3 meses Flor conduce un pequeño puesto de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños en los exteriores del mercado de Pomalca, esta labor la realiza todos los días de la semana.

Este negocio le brinda el único ingreso económico diario a su hogar y también le sirve para ayudar a sus padres, quienes dependen de ella debido a su avanzada edad.

Ella está solicitando por primera vez un crédito de 500 nuevos soles los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de más ropa para ampliar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus padres.

El sueño de Flor es convertirse en una comerciante mayorista de ropa y tener su propio local para vender este producto.
texts.en:
Flor is 50 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the area of Las Vegas, which is on the road to Pomalca, a small city located 15 minutes outside of Chiclayo. For three months, Flor has been operating a small vending post at the outdoor market in Pomalca. Every day she sells clothing for women, men, and children. This business is the only source of income for her daily living expenses and also helps to support her parents who are getting advanced in age. She is requesting her first loan of 500 soles to purchase more clothing to expand her business and help her continue supporting her parents. Flor dreams of becoming a clothing wholesaler and having her own store where she can sell her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea S. lives in Shi Sla village in Takeo province. She is 57 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are workers in the province while the other is a cow breeder. She is a grocer.

Mrs. Chea S.’s husband, Mr. Un Mean, is shown on the left of the photo. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he faces some problems because his field is infertile and he does not have enough money to hire laborers to work on the field. In order to deal these problems, Mrs. Chea S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on her husband's rice field

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs. Thol C. is a villager in Sdau Kanleng village in Kandal province. She is a 45-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a dessert seller, another is a cook and the third is attending the local school.

Mrs. Thol C. is a mango middle-woman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more mangoes to re-sell to earn more income to support her family’s expenses.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes to re-sell

loans.name: Rours

texts.en:
Mrs. Rours H. lives in Por Pel Kae village in Kandal province. She is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Veng Cham Roeun, is a construction worker. He is shown on the right in the photo. This couple has five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

Mrs. Rours H. is requesting a loan to build a house for her family in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To build a house for her family

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Mrs. Vann K. was born in 1970 and lives in Svay Chuor village in Kandal province. Her husband, Mr. Khorn Mach, is a hardworking man. This couple has three children, one of whom helps the business while the others are enrolled in the local school. 

Mrs. Vann K. is a vegetable middle-woman. In her business, she can earn only a little profit to support her family because she does not have much money to support her business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to resell to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell to earn more income

loans.name: Chansok

texts.en:
Mrs. Chansok S. is a villager in Svay Chuor village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Chi Chhun Long, are farmers who own a piece of land on which they grow vegetables.

In this, they face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to grow vegetables in their field. Thus, Mrs. Chansok S. needs a loan to buy cabbage seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to kill insects on the field.

Mrs. Chansok S. is 37 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cabbage seed, fertilizer, and pesticides

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nube Maricela

texts.es:
Nube es nativa de Azogues, ella vive por el parque central y nos cuenta que la mayoría de la gente en el sector  rural se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, y que los  hombres emigran al extranjero.

Ella tiene  24 años y divorciada desde hace 2 años, tiene un hijo de 2 años por el que tiene que responder sola, actualmente vive con sus padres.

 Es egresada en Economía y Finanzas en la Universidad Católica de Azogues  y esta realizando el seminario de graduación.

Nube tiene dos boutiques de ropa,  en la una tiene ropa variada para damas caballers y niños  y la otra exclusivamente de mujer;  trabaja con una prima de 9 AM a 9 PM, no cierra al medio día porque el trabajo  es rentable, sobre todo los fines de semana se vende mas, dice. 

Trabaja con ropa americana, panameña y nacional, tiene algunos  distribuidores y sus utilidades es más o menos de 400 a 500 dólares mensuales. Por  ejemplo en cada prenda tiene un utilidad de 5 dólares.

Le gusta la sociedad de crédito y el préstamo lo hará para adquirir más mercadería y ampliar su negocio. Su sueño es obtener el titulo profesional y luego comprarse una casa para así independizarse con su hijo.
texts.en:
Nube is a native of Azogues. She lives near the central park. She tells us that the majority of the people in the rural area work in agriculture and commerce, and that the men emigrate to other countries. She is 24 years old and has been divorced for 2 years. She has a 2 year old son for whom she alone is responsible. They currently live with Nube's parents. She has completed her studies in Economy and Finance at the Catholic University of Azogues and is currently completing the final "seminario de graduación", similar to a senior thesis on a particular topic, required before graduation. Nube has 2 clothing boutiques. In one she sells a variety of clothing for women, men and children, and in the other she exclusively sells women's clothing. She works with her cousin from 9 AM to 9 PM. She does not close at midday because the work is profitable, particularly on weekends, which is when she sells the most, she says. She works with american clothing, clothing made in Panama and clothing manufactured domestically, in Ecuador. She has some distributors and her profits are more or less 400 to 500 dollars per month. For example, she earns a profit of 5 dollars on each piece of clothing. She likes the local lending association and will use this loan to buy more merchandise and expand her business. Her dream is to earn her professional college degree and later buy herself a house so she can live independently with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise and expand her business

loans.name: Mrs. Naren Phoung Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people living in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan group, and they will use the loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Naren P. is the 22-year-old village bank president. She has two children who are enrolled in the local school. She owns a small coffee store in the local village and her husband, Mr. Khut Samnang, is a motor taxi driver.

Now, Mrs. Naren P.’s husband has a problem because he does not have enough money to fix his motorbike. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Naren P. decided to ask for a loan to enable her husband to repair his motorbike in order to re-start his business.

loans.use: To repair her husband's motorbike

loans.name: Norma De Jesus

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Más que Vencedoras esta ubicado en Azogues provincia del Cañar. Azogues es una ciudad muy bonita y se caracteriza por sus iglesias coloniales y su hermoso paisaje, la gente es muy cordial y amable, la mayor parte de personas se dedica a la agricultura y comercio.  

Norma es oriunda de Azogues, ella vive por el sector de la cárcel frente a la cuidad; tiene 43 años de edad y esta casada, de su matrimonio tiene 4 hijos de 28, 26, 23 y 18, solo dos de ellos viven con ella y los otros ya son independientes trabajan y estudian; su esposo tiene 52 años y esta enfermo de los riñones por lo que no trabaja,  solo es una compañía en el trabajo ya que  no puede hacer fuerza.Viven en casa propia.

Trabaja en el negocio de la madera desde hace 15 años, conjuntamente con su hijo y tres ayudantes más, existen temporadas buenas y malas, son buenos cuando comienzan a construir, venden a domicilio y en las bodegas. 
  
Norma solicitó el préstamo para  comprar un bosque y obtener mas madera para sus clientes. Es socia ya hace mucho tiempo, y da gracias por la fuerza y la ayuda que la brindan la Fundación ESPOIR.

El sueño de Norma es sacar adelante a su hijo para el futuro.
texts.en:
The communal bank Más que Vencedoras (More than Winners) is located in Azogues, in the Cañar province. Azogues is a very pretty city, distinguished by its colonial churches and beautiful scenery. The people are very warm and kind. Most of the people work in agriculture and commerce. Norma is a native of Azogues. She lives in the section of the city near the prison. She is 43 years old and married with 2 children, ages 28, 26, 23 and 18. Only two of our children live with her; the others are independent and work or study on their own. Her husband is 52 years old and is unable to work due to kidney disease. He merely keeps her company while she works, since he is unable to put forth any effort. They live in their own home. She has worked in the timber business for 15 years together with her son and 3 additional helpers. She has her good seasons and bad seasons. Business is good when construction is starting up; she sells at her client´´s homes and in stores. Norma applied for this loan in order to buy a forest and acquire more wood for her clients. She has been a partner of the Fundación Espoir for some time now. She is grateful for the effort and the help that the Fundación provides her. Norma dreams of continuing to move ahead, for her son and his future.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a forest and acquire more timber for her clients

loans.name: Sory

texts.en:
Sory S. is a 47-year-old village man who has had the job of fish-seller since he was single. Since early 2000, he has sold fresh fish that he buys from the people who earn a living as fisherman along the Tunle Sap River. He runs his business with his wife in the market and earns approximately $3 a day. The humble couple has four children who are going to school and are dependent on their parents’ income.

Sory S. has accumulated a number of clients but his stock of fish is not enough to serve them all. Therefore, he would like a loan to accumulate a larger quantity of fish to better meet his customers’ needs.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger quantity of fish to better meet his customers’ needs

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Mrs. Noun K., 52, is married with a new husband, Mr. Nao Hou, 38. She has six children: two sons and four daughters. Five of them are married and live outside the family house and the other one attends school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Noun has been selling fish for over ten years. She buys fish from fishermen in her village and sells in Prek Ho market. Her husband has been driving a motor taxi for over twenty years as well.

Noun wants to purchase a cow to raise at her home when she has free time from selling fish, but she doesn’t have enough money. So, Noun is applying for her first loan of US$500 to make the purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Ms. Pisey C., age 30, is single and lives with her parents on an Island of the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three brothers, one of whom is a construction worker, and two sisters. One of her sisters has full-time employment and the other one weaves silk at home.

Pisey has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market.

Pisey is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her sister to use to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her sister to use to drive to work

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Actually, fish is the main source of food for everybody in Cambodia and almost all of the Cambodian people depend on catching fish to earn a living.

One of these people is Mrs. Soun S., 49 years old. She and her husband wake up when the sky is still dark in order to prepare their equipment to fish in and around the Tunle Sap River which is the best place to catch fish. After they have finished fishing, they take the fish to sell at the local fish market.

This couple typically generates an income of $4 each day to manage their family and especially to meet the hunger of their four children. However, the family recently is facing difficulty with their living conditions due to their house needing repair. To solve the problem, Soun S. would like a loan to repair a part of her broken house.

loans.use: To repair a part of her broken house

loans.name: Yoen

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoen S., 45, and her husband, Mr. Sun Sam, 47, were married in 1989 and have three children: one son who is a garment factory worker and two daughters. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Yoen has been a farmer for 30 years growing rice. Her husband raises cows at home and assists his wife in farming as well.

Yoen wants to build an addition on her house which will make it better for her family members to live in. So, she is requesting her first loan of $500 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To build an addition on her house

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana tiene 36 años y vive en Pomalca, un distrito cuyos pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de caña de azúcar y que se encuentra ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 6 años mantiene un pequeño puesto informal en los exteriores del mercado de Pomalca en donde vende verduras, abarrotes, especias y aderezos previamente preparados. Este único ingreso económico le ha permitido solventar los gastos de su hogar donde vive únicamente con su madre de 65 años de edad, quien debido a su avanzada edad depende de Sebastiana.

Ella está solicitando por primera vez un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles, los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de artículos de primera necesidad (aceite, arroz, azúcar, etc.), lo que le va a permitir ampliar su negocio y seguir ayudando a su madre por quien trata de salir adelante para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 36 years old and she lives in Pomalca, a district where the inhabitants mostly grow sugar canes for a living. It is located 15 minutes from the town of Chiclayo.

For 6 years she has had an informal stall outside the market of Pomalca where she sells vegetables, groceries, spices and previously prepared dressings. This her only income has allowed her to meet the needs of her home where she lives with her 65-year-old mother who depends on Sebastiana due to her advanced age.

For the first time she requests a loan of 800 nuevos soles, to be invested in buying basic necessities (cooking oil, rice, sugar, etc.) in order to improve business and keep supporting her mother as she wishes to get ahead in order to offer her a better life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities for sale.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Mr. Soy S., age 38, and his wife, Mrs. Sreyvet Dam, age 28, live in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and have two daughters, both of whom are in school.

Soy has been driving a motor taxi for five years and his wife has been a garment factory worker for six years. The couple just finished their house construction. They want to add a restroom for the use of the family, but they lack the money. So, Soy is applying for his first loan of US$200 to add to his own money to build a restroom for his family’s use.

loans.use: To add to his own money to build a restroom for family use

loans.name: Ameir Mohammad Group

texts.en:
Ameir M. is the leader of the Ameir M. Group. There are two members in this group. Both of them would like to receive money for their businesses.

Ameir M. wants a loan for his taxi business. He wants to buy necessary materials for his business. Shayma Gull wants a loan for her husband’s general store. They all want to expand and improve their businesses.

With this loan, they can expand their businesses and support their families and make a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: Expand and improve their businesses

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia P. is a woman of courage, determined to bring her family out of poverty. Hailing from the island village of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines, she is the wife of Efren, a 47-year-old carpenter, and a mother to eight: five daughters and three sons.

With her dream of bringing her family out of poverty, Cecilia joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2003. Eager to help her husband in earning money to sustain their family needs, her hopes of having access to capital to start a business materialized. She wisely used her previous loans for her food vending business and as rolling capital for the retail of dried fish and bamboo sets, both her primary businesses and both productive enough to enable her to sustain the needs of her family.

Now on her eighth loan, Cecilia is requesting 19,000 pesos as additional rolling capital for her businesses. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for 40 pieces of bamboo beds, 2 bamboo sets, 40 kilos of assorted dried fish, all for resale, and a gallon of cooking oil, sugar, bananas, and pork for her food vending business.

She is hopeful that with the help of ASHI and KIVA, she can reach her dreams of sending her children to school, having a rolling store, and repairing her house to make it more spacious and durable.

loans.use: Additional capital for resale and food vending businesses.

loans.name: Segundo Virgilio

texts.es:
Segundo es un padre de familia de 48 años de edad que reside en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 15 minutos de Chiclayo; el vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos menores de edad los cuales son todavía estudiantes.

Desde hace tres años tiene un automóvil con el que trabaja brindando el servicio de transporte de pasajeros cubriendo la ruta Chiclayo – Lambayeque y viceversa, esta es la única actividad con la que sostiene a su familia.

Ultimamente el automóvil de Segundo, debido al constante uso, ha comenzado a experimentar algunas fallas técnicas en el motor, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de recurrir a solicitar un préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles.

Segundo es un excelente cliente de nuestra Institución y ya lleva cancelando 6 créditos en forma puntual, su más grande anhelo es comprarse otro automóvil para poder seguir educando a sus hijos y convertirlos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 48-year-old father who lives in the town of Lambayeque located 15 minutes from Chiclayo. He lives with his wife and two under-aged school-going children.

For three years he has worked offering passenger transportation in his vehicle, covering the route Chiclayo-Lambayeque, round trip, and this represents the only income to support his family.

Lately Segundo's vehicle has begun having soms technical problems with the motor and therefore he needs to request a loan of 2500 nuevos soles.

Segundo is an excelent customer of our Institution and has already repaid 6 loans punctually. It is his greatest dream to buy an automobile in order to continue paying for his children's education so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motor repair

loans.name: Sokhea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhea Y., 45, and her husband, Mr. On Ork, 47, live along National Road Number five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1985 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. One of them is married and lives in a separate house.
 
Sokhea has been growing rice since she was married. Her husband, Mr. On Ork has been selling cows and oxen. She is applying for her first loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a cart to connect with a motorized hand tiller to use for her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a cart to connect with motorized hand tiller to use for her farming business.

loans.name: Mah Gull Group

texts.en:
Mah Gull is the group leader of Mah Gull Group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to expand and improve their businesses. They have requested a group loan of 42000 Afghani. 

Mah Gull wants a loan for her tailoring business. She very happy with this loan. She hopes to expand and improve her business. Fahema wants a loan for her husband’s leather business. Zeya Gull wants a loan for the beaker business that she runs in her house. She wants to buy a stick for her business. They send thanks to all Kiva and AFSG lenders who help poor people in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Sonim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonim S., 29 (pictured with her husband), and her husband, Mr. Socheat Yum, 28, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 20 kilometers away. They were married in 2001 and have three young daughters.
 
Sonim has been a garment factory worker for 10 years. Her husband has been a teacher for five years. His motorbike is old and he wants to replace it with a new one, so Sonim is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to make the replacement.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.name: Yesenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yesenia Elizabeth M. D. C. resiD. en el municipio D. San Martin en la capital D. El Salvador. Yesenia vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos todos menores D. edad, Yesenia y su esposo luchan día a día para darle lo mejor a sus hijos brindándoles la educación escolar que ellos no lograron. Esta joven madre se desempeña en su propio negocio una panadería con ocho años D. experiencia, la cual ahora da trabajo a siete empleados y es la panadería más popular y demanda en la zona, el crédito que solicita Yesenia es para compra D. materia prima para su pan, ya que desea ampliar su producción para seguir expandiendo su negocio el cual es el pilar económico para familia C. M.
texts.en:
Yesenia Elizabeth M. D. C. lives in the municipality of San Martin in the capital of El Salvador. Yesenia lives in her own house with her husband and their four minor children. Yesenia and her husband struggle hard to give their children the schooling they did not get themselves. This young mother has eight years of experience in her own bakery, she now has seven employees and it is the most popular bakery in the area. The loan requested by Yesenia it to buy raw material for her bread as she wishes to increase the production in order to make her business grow as it represents the main income for the C. M. family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Mastora Group

texts.en:
Mastora is the group leader of the Mastora Group. There are four members in this group. Each would like to expand his/her business. 

Mastora is a tailor. She has been interested in tailoring since she was a child. When she was young, she decided to work as a tailor. Now she has a good number of clients, so she wants to add to the number of her clients by purchasing a new sewing machine and the other required materials of tailoring. 

Aziza and Monyra would like to have a loan to complete their business requirements. Rohalah is a taxi driver. He has worked as a driver for more than 10 years. He needs to buy a new machine for his taxi to work better and to increase his income. 

They have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani. They all want to send many thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Delia Reyna

texts.es: Delia Reyna F. de 57 años de edad  reside en San Martin municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Delia vive sola ya que todos sus hijos se fueron de casa porque se encuentran casados. Delia no cuenta con ninguna ayuda económica constante ya que carece de cualquier tipo de cuota por pensión, es por eso que Delia es firme al administrar su negocio con el cual ha logrado mantenerse ya por doce años, Delia tiene ubicado un pequeño bazar en su casa donde vende ropa y  materiales de confección y costura, el destino del crédito que solicita en esta oportunidad Delia es para surtir su negocio comprando variedad de mercadería atractiva para sus clientes; de esta manera lograra aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Delia Reyna F. is 57 years old and lives in San Martin, a municipality of the department of San Salvador. Delia lives alone as all her children are married and live elsewhere. Delia has no constant economic support as she does not receive any pension and therefore Delia stays firm in administering her business and she has done so for twelve years. Delia has a small bazar at home where she sells clothes and material for tailoring and dress-making. The loan requested this time by Delia will be spent on buying a variety of attractive merchandise for her customers in order to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for business.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl C. is a hardworking rice grower in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She is 28 years old and has six children. She is helping her husband, Edito C., till a 2.5-hectare farm that she owns. The profit that she gets from growing rice is definitely used in paying the tuition, and in buying food, clothing and her family's daily costs.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchase two sacks of complete fertilizer and urea. The loan will help her achieve maximum harvest on her farm.

CEVI helps small business grow. They provide their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase urea and fertilizer

loans.name: Concepción Ángel

texts.es: Concepción Ángel R. de 49 años de edad reside en Armenia municipio del departamento de Sonsonate. Concepción vive solamente con su madre Doña María de 77 años de edad, juntas se  apoyan para atender el negocio con el cual han logrado salir adelante en el transcurso de los doce años que tienen de poseer su Tienda, la cual se encuentra ubicada en el mismo lugar donde viven. Concepción y su madre no abandonan la idea de seguir prosperando y hacer crecer su negocio y es por ello que ahora solicitan este crédito,  para surtir su negocio con nueva mercadería que les ayude a aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias .
texts.en:
Concepción Ángel R. is 49 years old and lives in Armenia, municipality of the department of Sonsonate. Concepción lives alone with her mother Doña Maria, 77 years old. They support each other with the store they have managed to make successful for the past twelve years. The store is located at their home. Concepción and her mother have the idea of keeping going and making their business grow and therefore they now request this loan in order to buy new merchandise for their business to increase sales and obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for business.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a member of the Matatizao borrower group.She is 39 years old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 19,15, and 8 years.

 Munira started her own food business selling Urojo 2 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 50,000.

This is Munira first loan from BRAC.she requested the amount of 450,000 in order to buy more commodities for her business.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Munira hopes to save more money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Mola Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Maua  is a member of the Mola Tubariki,she is 43 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 6 children.Her children are aged 25,22,19,16,15,9 years.

Maua started her own clothing business selling kanga,vitenge(fabric) 10 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 170,000 Tsh.

This is Maua second loan from BRAC ,she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Maua hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

Pavu,Ummu,Mwengwi,Patima,and Safia are also the member of the same borrower group,they also requested the loan in order to expand their business

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Olga Corina

texts.es: Olga Corina C. D. C. resiD. en el departamento D. San Vicente ubicado en la zona D. occidente D. El Salvador. Olga vive con su esposo quien trabaja como motorista D. un camión y su aporte neto a la familia es D. $150.00 US mensuales, también viven con ellos sus dos  hijos Miguel D. 17 años y Carmen D. 14 años D. edad, los niños se encuentran estudiando. Olga posee su negocio ubicado en su casa es una  tienda con productos D. consumo diario la cual se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, Olga solita un crédito para surtir su negocio y así poder brindar un excelente servicios y variedad D. productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Olga Corina C. D. C. lives in the San Vicente District, which is located in the western part of El Salvador. Her husband works as a truck driver, and his income brings in $150 USD each month for their family. They have two children, Miguel (age 17) and Carmen (age 14), who are both students.

Olga operates a business from her home selling daily household products. She is requesting a loan to restock her business so that she can proviD. her customers with excellent service and a wiD. variety of products.
