The “Vera Cruz” group is represented by Cinda. The group is composed of 13 members who work in different economic activities. Half of the women sell shoes and make clothing; the other half of the women sell bread and groceries from small neighborhood stores. The men in the group work are taxi drivers. Competition at the commercial level and in product sales is high because there are a variety of products available in a range of prices. Because of this, the group members have to work hard to make their businesses successful by making clothing that follows changes in the market. The loan will be used for buying materials such as fabrics, for merchandise such as grocery items to increase stock, and replacement parts for their cars. This will help the members improve their incomes and therefore be able to proviD. their families a better quality of life. The group members have experience from working with previous groups formed by other institutions, so they are familiar with the concept of working in solidarity lending groups and they know how to work together for increased benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Irineo

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102642&_tpos=f&_tpg=h
Irineo es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Irineo se dedica a dar servicio de moto-taxi y cría de chanchos, con las ganancias de    sus negocios ha podido comprase otra moto-car.  
El préstamo ha ayudado ha que pueda crecer económicamente
Ireneo necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para arreglar sus motores de su moto-car.
El sueño de Irineo luchar por sacar adelante a sus  hijos y  quiere comprase un carro para taxiar.
texts.en:
Irineo is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de las Mercedes”. He operates a moto-taxi service and also raises pigs. Using the profits from his businesses, he was able to purchase another moto-car. His previous loans have helped him grow financially. Irineo is in need of a loan of 1600 soles to repair the engines of his moto-car. He dreams of fighting for the success of his children and wants to buy a sidecar for his taxi. Click here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102642&_tpos=f&_tpg=h to view Irineo’s previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Engine repairs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia se dedica a la fabricación de mantas y macramé; estos productos da a terceras personas para que las puedan comercializar, su esposo es chofer asalariado, esos son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus seis hijos los cuales todavía se encuentran estudiando, vive en casa propia ubicado en la Zona de Villa Ingavi de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de Maquina de coser domestica y con eso podrá elaborar mas mantas y así poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Virginia.
texts.en:
Virginia produces blankets and macramé items. She provides her products to third party vendors to sell on her behalf. Her husband is a salaried driver, and both of their incomes cover the living expenses of their six school-aged children. They live in their own home, which is located in the Villa Ingavi district of the city of El Alto.

Virginia will use her loan to buy a domestic sewing machine so that she can produce more blankets and increase her earnings. This is her first loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicated she is qualified for an approved loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar trabaja como transportista, tiene un taxi, la esposa tiene una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en la ciudad de el Alto; estas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con las que cubren la manutención de sus dos pequeñas hijas de 4 y 6 años. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la Villa Tunari de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (arroz, fideo, azucar, sodas, dulces,etc.) para la tienda de abarrotes en la que trabaja la esposa.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarlo otro préstamo solicitado por el prestatario.
texts.en:
Cesar transports people with his own taxi. His wife has a grocery store in the city of El Alto. These activities are their principal sources of income, and provide support for their two small children, ages 4 and 6. They live in their parents' house, located in Villa Tunari within El Alto city.

The loan will be used for buying merchandise (rice, beans, sugar, sodas, sweets, etc) for the wife's grocery store. This will be their second loan from Impro and their good payment performance justifies approval of this second request for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, beans, sugar, sweets, etc for his wife's grocery store

loans.name: Akuwo

texts.fr:
cette dame exerce comme activité principale le commerce de pagnes,elle y a associé le commerce de draps et de couverture, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006 et l'exerce de façon ambulante. ce commerce lui réussit bien, elle veut par conséquent l'agrandir, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes, 10 draps et 10 couvertures. Maîtrisant parfaitement son commerce, elle compte donner le meilleur d’elle-même.
elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a lady who earns an income from commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth).  She has included with it commerce in bed sheets and blankets.  She's been in this business since 2006 and goes door-to-door.  It's a business that's very successful for her.  Consequently, she wants to expand it and is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 10 bolts of pagne cloth, 10 bed sheets, and 10 blankets.  With an excellent command of her business, she intends to give it her best.  She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagne" cloth, bedsheets, and blankets

loans.name: Maymaffench (We Will Try) Group

texts.en: Kebbeh is illiterate, a single parent with 4 children (grade level – 5th grade), who has been involved in the sale of rice at retail prices for the past 8 years now. Illnesses have been her greatest challenge. She dreams of having a rice store for herself and hopes to have house for the children and adequately educate all of them.

loans.use: bags of rice for sale retail

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio tiene un pequeño taller de servicio de frenos y cambio de balatas de movilidades y por las noches trabaja como transportista, es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de tres hijos y esposa; tiene su casa propia ubicada en la Zona Ventilla de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la compra de maquinaria (calibradores de frenos) y repuestos para el taller y de esa forma podrá facilitar su trabajo y ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Herminio has a small shop that services brakes and changes brake linings. In the evenings he works as a driver. It is the main source of income to support his three children and his wife. He has his own house, which is located in the Ventilla zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy machinery (brake calibrators) and replacement parts for his shop. This will facilitate his work, and he will give his customers better service. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy brake calibrators and replacement parts for his brake and brake lining repair shop

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Living in a hacienda (sugar plantation) is very tough. People work long hard hours for low wages that are not even enough to feed a family of four, much less a family with seven children. But Mrs. Marlyn C. of Hacienda Victoria, Tabao Rizal, San Enrique, Negros Occidental was determined to help her husband support their large family, and send her children to school.

For the past twelve years, since she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marlyn has engaged in food vending, selling a variety of nutritious snack food such as sugar-coated fried bananas, commonly known as "bananaque" because the bananas are sold skewered on barbecue sticks, to her neighbors and the surrounding communities within the sugar plantation where she lives.

In addition to food vending, Marlyn has a "sari-sari" or general store which her husband manages while she goes around selling her snacks to the field workers and their neighbors. The income they jointly earn helps in sending the three youngest children to school.

For her 9th loan, Marlyn is borrowing Php 9,500 to purchase a "trisikad" - a bike with a side-car so that she can use to go around the neighboring communities a lot faster and reach further to sell her snack food. Some of the loan will be used as additional capital for her food-vending and for the "sari-sari" (general) store.

Explaining the term "trisikad":

Filipinos are fond of coining new terms for the practical gizmos we dream up. Some of you might have read some "Only in the Philippines" anecdotes - and the trisikad is another one of those. The term trisikad is a combination of an English and Hiliganon (a dialect in Western Visayas) word - tricycle because of the three wheels (the bike + sidecar) - but then the term tricycle is already used for motorcycles with sidecars so to distinguish it, and to emphasize that it is not motorized, the Hiligaynon word "sikad" meaning to kick or to pedal was used instead - resulting in the uniquely Ilonggo "trisikad".


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business and to buy a trisikad

loans.name: Rimber

texts.es:
Rimber es propietario de dos terneros y de cuatro vacas lecheras, es productor de leche, la cual vende a PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), esta  es su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de sus padres que ya están ancianos y cubre sus estudios de profesor de música;  vive en la comunidad Huayrocondo Provincia Los Andes  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana  calidad, misma que le ayudará para mayor producción de leche y por ende una mejora en sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por el cliente.
texts.en:
Rimber owns two calves and four milk cows. He produces milk, which he sells to PIL (Industrialized Milk Plant). This is his primary income source to support his elderly parents and to cover his education costs. He is studying to be a music teacher. He lives in the Huayrocondo community in the Los Andes province in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy a medium quality milking cow. The cow will help with greater milk production and improve his income. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a milk cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en: Grace A. is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. For the past five years, this hard-working lady has operated both a retail shop and a tailoring business.  This is her first loan request with the group, and she plans to use the money to purchase additional products for her shop and increase the quantities of the products that she currently carries to ensure that profits increase. As well, she wants to increase the stock of clothes for her tailoring business, hoping to thereby double her profits.  She is grateful for the help rendered to the group.

loans.use: Restocking both her retail and tailoring businesses.

loans.name: Be Together Group

texts.en: Currently, Korto sells her items off a table located in the town of Kpayea in the Zorzor District. She is illiterate and a single parent with four children, of whom none is in school. She is currently engaged in the sale of dry goods and hopes to purchase a larger table. She dreams of supporting all of her children in school and providing good medical care.

loans.use: To purchase a larger table so that she can sell oil, pepper, onions, and other dry goods.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Ce Monsieur exerce depuis 2006 le commerce de détail de jeunes plants dans le quartier Atikoumé à Lomé.ce commerce lui réussit bien, il veut agrandir son stock de jeunes plants, c'est pour cette raison qu'il  sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 40 jeunes plants. il Compte sur son expérience et sa connaissance du secteur  pour permettre  à son commerce de prospérer. 
Il est marié et a 03 personnes à sa charge.
texts.en:
This gentleman has been selling young plants retail since 2006 in the Atikoumé neighborhood in Lomé. This business is succeeding and he wants to expand his stock of young plants. That is the reason why he has asked WAGES for a loan to buy 40 young plants. He is counting on his experience and his knowledge of this sector to permit his business to prosper.

He is married and has 3 people for whom he is responsible.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of young plants

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora se dedica a la venta de comida en la zona donde vive, su esposo la abandonó, ella sola mantiene a sus tres hijos los cuales todavía están estudiando; lamentablemente en esta temporada subieron los precios de los abarrotes y es por eso que requiere comprar por cantidad los mismos para conseguir mejorar sus costos; vive en alquiler la casa queda ubicada en la zona Río Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de abarrotes (fideo y arroz) y así poder incrementar sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Teodora.
texts.en:
Teodora sells food in the area where she lives. Her husband abandoned her. She supports her three children by herself. The children still go to school. Sadly, the prices of groceries have gone up this season. That is why she needs to buy wholesale to improve her costs. She lives in a rented house, which is in the Río Seco zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy groceries (noodles and rice) to be able to increase her income. This is her first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies Teodora for the loan she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale noodles and rice to reduce costs in her business of selling food

loans.name: We Are One Group

texts.en: Tongor is a 35 year-old single Liberian mother with three children. She has been selling dry fish for the past six years now. Her biggest challenge has been the many illnesses she has had to overcome. She wishes to purchase a larger table in order to have larger quantity of fishes to sell at different prices. It is her goal to have enough income to support all of her children.

loans.use: To purchase a larger table so that she can sell additional cartoons of dry fish

loans.name: Jonifa Kavulavi

texts.en:
Jonifa is 50 years and married with five children. Her husband Cleb works as a driver. She lives in the Thiongo Road area, also where she does her business. 

Jonifa was introduced to KADET by her friends who had already joined the group. Thiongo Road is a peri-urban area where there are very few businesses. She sells clothes to neighbours and people in the wider area.

Jonifa hopes to build her own house which will reduce her home expenses as well as pay school fees for her children.

She also intends to build a shop for her business so that she can settle down and have a more permanent place.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing in order to expand her business and sell from a more permanent location

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia se dedica a la fabricación de mantas y macramé; estos productos los comercializa en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto los días jueves y domingo; su esposo la abandono, ella sola mantiene a sus cuatro hijos los cuales todavía están estudiando, vive en casa propia donde tiene dos cuartos de adobe; la casa queda ubicada en la Zona Villa Ingavi de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de Maquina de coser domestica y con eso podrá elaborar mas mantas y así poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Eugenia.
texts.en:
Eugenia makes large shawls and macrame which she sells at the July 16th market in the City of El Alto on Thursdays and Sundays. Abandoned by her husband, she alone cares for her four children who are still in school. She lives in her own house, with just two adobe rooms. It's located in the Villa Ingavi Zone within El Alto.

The loan is for purchasing a domestic sewing machine which will enable her to make more shawls and thus increase her income. This is her first loan from Impro. Their evaluation recommends approval of Eugenia's loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A DOMESTIC SEWING MACHINE FOR HER SHAWL MAKING BUSINESS.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other agricultural inputs

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es:
Gilda Tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes de barrio, el esposo es chofer asalariado; estas actividades constituyen su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos. Vive en alquiler ubicada en la Zona Ballivián de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería para la tienda y de esa forma podrá surtir, ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos para la venta a sus clientes.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Gilda has a small neighborhood grocery store and her husband works as a salaried driver. These jobs provide their main source of income to support their three children. They rent in the Ballivián district in the city of El Alto. Gilda plans to use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her store so she can offer her customers a wider selection of products. This will be her first loan with Impro and our evaluation confirms that she qualifies to borrow the funds.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en: Mary has two children and never attended school. She sells dry goods - a business which started from a bottle of oil about five years ago. She dreams of expanding her business sales in order to provide her children educational opportunities and also give them good shelter.

loans.use: To obtain additional goods such as rice, salt, oil, etc. in order to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Kadidja

texts.fr:
cette femme a commencé en 2000, le commerce de pagnes, plus tard elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de produits cosmétiques et de mèches. sa clientèle ne cesse de grandir, le stock de marchandises dont elle dispose présentement ne lui permet pas de faire face convenablement à la demande de ses clients. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes, 4 cartons de mèches et divers produits cosmétiques. ainsi elle pourra rehausser son stock et satisfaire tous ses clients.
elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2000, this woman started doing commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth). Later, she included along with it the sale of cosmetic products and hair extensions. Her customers continuously grow in number, and the stock of merchandise that she has presently does not allow her to address the demand appropriately. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 bolts of pagne cloth, 4 boxes of hair extensions, and various cosmetics. Then she will be able to replenish her stock and to satisfy all her customers. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, cosmetic products, and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
K. Hellen is the leader of her first lending group in Mukono. She is 31 years old and a business lady with a hardware shop that she has owned for the past year in Nabuti. She wishes to use her loan to expand and buy more products such as paints and nails to earn additional profits. At the moment, she makes weekly profits worth 50,000. However, this is still too little profit; consequently, she wishes to grow her business. 

Hellen has a family, including her husband and three children, aged one to nine, and she wants to see them grow into responsible people with good education.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of hardware shop items so she can sell to the community

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
Anacleta trabaja como comerciante de comida de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana va a su comunidad a cuidar sus animales tiene dos hijas las cuales ya están casadas, es viuda y vive en alquiler; la venta de comida es la  fuente de ingreso con  que cubre su manutención; su domicilio esta ubicada en la Zona de Vila Ingavi de la Ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de Abarrotes (fideo, arroz y acite) y así podrá incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Anacleta.
texts.en:
Anacleta sells food Monday through Friday. On the week ends she goes to her community to take care of her animals. She has two married daughters. She is a widow, and she rents where she lives. Selling food is her source of income to support herself. Her home is located in the Vila Ingave zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy groceries (noodles, rice, and oil) in order to be able to increase her income. This is her first loan with Imro. The completed evaluation qualifies Anacleta for the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy noodles, rice, and oil for her food selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Aurelie

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali-Rwanda! U. Aurelie is 40 years old, married and produces an income of 300000. She has five children (aged 14 years, ten years, nine years, seven years and five years) and has six years of experience selling smearing oil. Currently, she employs two people who work from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM. The monthly profit is 350,000.

Now, she is requesting a first loan of 500,000 from Vision Finance to be repaid in eight months for the purpose of expanding her business and earning more profit than currently. With this profit, she will also be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional smearing oil to sell

loans.name: Jilna

texts.en:
Mrs. Jilna J. of Brgy. Lopez Jaena, Sagay City, Negros Occidental is a strong, 50-year old woman who is unwavering in her mission to fight poverty and improve the lives of her family. With her husband and three children, she works hard to make life better for everyone. 

Mrs. J. owns and manages a business that has grown over the last five years to become a combination of a   "sari-sari" (General) store, a "cafeteria" (coffee and snack shop) and a "carinderia" (eatery or small luncheonette). She has done well for herself and now earns approximately Php 15,000 per month, which is a big help to the family's finances.

Jilna is now borrowing PHP 19,000 to add to her revolving working capital for her slowly but surely expanding business. She hopes that her tireless work plus a little help from the loan will take her a few steps nearer to the achievement of her dream: financial security for her family. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional capital for the sari-sari store, cafeteria and carinderia

loans.name: One Banana Tree Group

texts.en: Joseph is a 29 year old, young Liberian father with the educational level of a high school student and has four children. He is also engaged in the sale of dry goods for the past four years now.  He anticipates to expand his dry goods table to a larger one so that he can accommodate more goods. He wishes to have a home for himself and to be able to send all of his children to school.

loans.use: To purchase a larger table so that he can sell addition bags of rice, onions, salt, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other agricultural inputs

loans.name: Kukapakia Group

texts.en: Belekai never went to school and is a widow with six children who are all high school graduates. She has an additional three orphans that she also takes care of. For the past ten years, she has been selling dry goods including rice and oil. The lack of sufficient funding is the main challenge, but she hopes to build a shop and to provide good education and medical care to the children as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional bags of rice for sale

loans.name: Scovia's Group

texts.en:
N. Scovia is a business lady with a strong drive to succeed through business and hard work. For ten years now, she has run a a bar and a hotel in Kireku. Just like most businesses, Scovia started small but over the years, her businesses have grown and now she hopes to further expand. At the moment, she is able to make weekly profits of 50,000 and wants to double this in the near future. 

She has a family of three and takes care of three orphans. She prepares local food at the restaurant, then operates the bar in the evenings.This is Scovia’s first requested loan and she hopes to buy more food stuffs and drinks for her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs for the restaurant and drinks for the bar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr:
cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d'ignames, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2006.  elle dispose d'une grande clientèle dont des proprietaires de restaurant et s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de sokodé. son stock de marchandises a connu une baisse, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 tas d'ignames et assurer le transport de la marchandises.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle habite avec sa famille dans le quartier Adidogomé.
texts.en:
This lady earns a living selling yams. She began this business in 2006. She has a sizeable clientele, among others restaurant owners, and buys her merchandise in the back country in the town of Sokodé. Her inventory is down, and so she would like to replenish it and is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 25 heaps of yams and pay for transporting them.

She is married and the mother of 2 children; she lives with her family in the Adidogomé neighborhood.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing yams for resale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo”, ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Chijuyo Copapujo del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y madre de 2 hijos, ella estudió educación secundaria completa, vive en el centro poblado de Chijuyo Copapujo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace mas de 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de sogas y zapatillas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va a adquirir sogas.  También tiene un negocio de venta de zapatillas los días de feria en la zona.

Su deseo es dedicarse a la venta de animales mayores.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las reuniones y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Margarita lives in Chijuyo Copapujo and is a member of its Community Bank, located in Ilave district, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 25 years old, living in a civil union, and is the mother of two children. She completed secondary education.

Margarita has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for more than two years. Her first loan was for $200, which served as capital for buying ropes and slippers or pumps. Presently, she needs an additional loan of $875 to buy ropes. In addition, she has a business selling slippers or pumps on market days in her region. Her goal is to sell large livestock.

She enjoys the savings bank, the community meetings, and the training chats.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY ROPES AND SLIPPERS OR PUMPS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing sweet potatoes

loans.name: Kevina's Group

texts.en: N. Kevina is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 29 years old and divorced with 4 children aged 10 – 4 years as she cares for 2 dependents. Kevina has a restaurant in Kiyunga that has been operational for 6 months selling local foods like matooke (plantains), rice, posho, beans, and chicken plus all other kinds of sauce. Before this, Kevina was selling snacks that were not able to grow her profits weekly. At the moment, she makes weekly profits of 70,000/= and she would like to build a family house for her children plus ensuring that all of them attain the best of education. She needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs and chairs for her restaurant.

loans.use: Buying more foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose Luis de 32 años de edad es soltero, pero vive en union libre con la mamá de niño de 4 años de edad que asiste al pre-escolar, trabaja como conductor en el MINSA del Rama con 9 años de servicio, esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6to credito para acondicionar un cuarto, pues habita en casa de sus padres los que le dieron para hacer un cuartito en un garaje, al cual desea quitarle los portones y levantar pared dejando espacio para hacer una puerta que de salida independiente a la calle, ademas desea cerrar una puerta que une a la sala de su mamá y de esta manera tratar de independizar a su familia.   El mayor sueño de Jose Luis es poder tener un lugar con el cual pueda estar junto a su familia con las condiciones basicas y que su hijo crezca en un ambiente alegre.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is 32 years old and single, but lives in a free union with the mother of his 4 year old child, who currently attends preschool. Jose Luis has worked as a driver for the MINSA del Rama for 9 years. He is asking for refinancing on his sixth loan so he can renovate his living quarters. He stays at his parents' house in a small room in the garage. He wants to take out the main doors and raise the walls so there is room to construct a door that leads directly to the street as well as seal the door that connects his quarters to those of his mother's in attempt to try and make his family more independent. Jose Luis' biggest dream is to be able to have a place where he can be near his family, their basic living conditions are met, and that his son grows up in a happy environment.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise a wall and install a door

loans.name: Tindando Group

texts.en: Nathaniel is a 37-year-old Liberian who has been involved in the sale of used clothes for about 3 years now. He’s married with 5 children and stopped his schooling at 8th grade. He encountered difficulty during his 1-month-long illness which rendered him financially depressed and this was really a challenge to him.  He’s desirous of building a home for himself and his children.

loans.use: bales of used clothes for retail sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Aku Esse

texts.fr:
cette dame réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois. actuellement son stock a baissé, ce qui a entrainé une baisse de ses recettes. elle veut reconstituer son stock pour rehausser ses recettes, c'est pour cette raison qu'elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 22 sacs de charbons de bois.
avec ce qu'elle gagne comme revenu de son commerce, elle contribue aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
This lady lives with her family in the Adidogomé neighborhood, an outlying district of the town of Lomé. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She earns a living selling charcoal. Presently her stock is low and that has caused her receipts to fall. She wants to replenish her stocks to raise her receipts, and for this reason she has asked WAGES for a loan to buy 22 sacks of charcoal.

With the income from her business, she contributes to supporting her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo”, ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Chijuyo Copapujo del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada y madre de 2 hijos, ella estudió secundaria ipero solo hasta 4to grado, vive en la Comunidad de Chijuyo Copapujo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 01 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le lo utilizara como capital para la fabricación de sogas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va a adquirir cabuya (mateiral para elaborar sogas) de Desaguadero (distrito) para la fabricación de sogas, para venderlo en la feria de Juli e Ilave.
Su deseo es poner una panadería.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa is a a member of Community Bank "Chijuyo Copapujo," located in the central village of Chijuyo Copapujo of the key district, in the province of El Collao, in the Puno Department. She is 42 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. She studied only until the 4th grade, and lives in the community of Chijuyo Copapujo. She works with the Manuela Ramos Movement, as she has been for almost a year. Her first loan was for $175, which she used for capital to create ropes. Now, she requests an additional loan of $175 which she wants to use to purchase cabuya, which is a natural fiber used to create rope, from the Desaguadero district for the production of ropes, to sell them in the fair of Juli and key. Her dream is to start a bakery. She likes the loan facilities.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cabuya (a natural fiber for creating rope)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To store and purchase grains

loans.name: Emmanuel's Group

texts.en:
M. Emmanuel is a businessman with a bar that he has owned for 8 years. He is a person who has worked hard for his family and business to the extent that he would like to see his bar grow much farther. At the moment, Emmanuel is able to make weekly profits worth 40,000/=, and his main challenge is that at times he gets threats of robbery. He is becoming conscious of buying his stock during the day and avoiding late nights.

Emmanuel needs a loan to be able to restock his bar with more beers, spirits and wines so that he will be able to make more profit. He is a married man with 4 children as he cares for 1 orphan plus paying their school fees and general upkeep.

loans.use: Restocking his bar with more drinks

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza es socia, del Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 5 hijos y presenta estudios de primaria completa, vive en el Urb. Asiruni.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 06 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de frutas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de plátanos, piñas, naranjas, mandarinas, papayas, plátanos  y otras frutas.

Su sueño es poner un Kiosco de frutas bien surtido y vender al por mayor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros además la puntualidad de sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a member of the 3 De Mayo II Community Bank, which is located in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 38, married, and has five children. She has an elementary school education. She lives in the Urb. Asiruni. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost six years. She used her initial loan of 300 PEN to buy fruit. She now needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy bananas, pineapples, oranges, tangerines, papayas, and other fruit. Her dream is to set up a well stocked kiosk and to sell wholesale. She likes the savings and get-togethers (of her community bank). She also likes her colleagues’ punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bananas, pineapples, oranges, tangerines, papayas, and other fruit

loans.name: Clemencia Benita

texts.es: Clemencia Benita S. Chavarría tiene la edad de 59 años. Es una madre soltera que lucha son sobrevivir con sus 2 hijos que tiene a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad que con mucho esfuerzo logro mantener. Ella recorre ciertas calles, todos los días tiene que tomar una ruta diferente que la traslade a los mercados, para ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante, Clemencia ocupa un cuaderno en donde registra a sus clientes y todos los días cobra el dinero ya sea de perfumes, pantalones, camisas, ropa interior y sandalias. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de mercadería en general. Su mayor sueño es que su hija vuelva a estudiar ya que no tiene los suficientes ingresos para ayudarle.
texts.en:
Clemencia Benita S. Chavarría is 59 years old and a single mother who fights to survive with her 2 children for whom she cares. The economic activity to which she dedicates herself is the sale of general goods. For more than 4 years she has been dedicated to this work that she has succeeded in maintaining with much effort. She walks along certain streets, every day taking a different route that moves towards the markets, to sell her products in ambulatory fashion. Clemencia has a notebook in which she registers her clients and every day day charges them money from perfumes, pants, shirts, underwear and sandals. The loan that she requests is for working capital which would be used for buying general merchandise. Her biggest dream is that her daughter return to school now that she does not have enough income to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Alicia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Alicia del Socorro R. de 61 años de edad, reside en el barrio Camilo Chamorro en la capital de Managua,  tiene dos hijos mayores de edad,  su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace treinta años logro administrar, también vende medicamentos y productos escolares todo esto lo logro con ayuda de su esposo. El préstamo lo quiere para comprar granos básicos, carnes, leche y otros productos de consumo diario. Con este préstamo espera obtener mejores ganancias. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los préstamos ya que lograra sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Alicia del Socorro R., 61, lives in the Camilo Chamorro neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She has two grown children. She has run her mini market for 30 years. She also sells medicines and school products. She achieved all of this with help from her husband. She wants the loan to buy basic grains, meat, milk, and other daily consumption products. She expects to get greater earnings with this loan. She is grateful to the institution for the support of the loans in achieving her objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, meat, and daily consumption products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell food items

loans.name: Jancinta

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús”, ubicado en la cuidad D. Juliaca, provincia D. San Román, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 7 hijos (solo dos a su cargo), ella estudió educación secundaria completa,  y vive   el Barrio Manco Cápac.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace mas D. 7 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocio D. Internet.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va a adquirir arroz, papa, fideos, aceite, gas y otros para su restaurante, ella también tiene su negocio D. servicio D. duchas calientes.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal-
texts.en:
Jacinta is a member of the Corazon D. Jesus Communal Bank which is in the city of Juliaca, San Roman province, Puno department. She is 57 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children, two of whom are still dependent on her. She completed secondary school and lives in the Manco Capac neighborhood. For the past 7 years she has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement; her first loan was for 300 new soles which she used as start-up capital for her Internet business. She now requests an additional loan of 500 new soles with which she intends to buy rice, potatoes, pasta, oil, gas and other supplies for her restaurant. She also runs a hot shower business. Her goal is to continue working thereby paying household expenses. She likes the savings and the meetings of her Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, potatoes, pasta, oil and gas.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: cette femme réside dans le quartier d'agoè logopé, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de pagnes, mèches et produits cosmétiques, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2007 et le fait de façon ambulante. voulant agrandir son commerce pour gagner beaucoup plus d'argent, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 pièces de pagnes "HI-target", 5 cartons de mèches,4 cartons de perruques et divers produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
This is a woman who resides in the Agoè Logopé district. She is married and the mother of four. Her revenue-generating business involves commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth), hair extensions, and cosmetics. She started this business in 2007 and operates door-to-door. Wanting to expand her business to earn more money, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 15 bolts of HI-Target pagnes, 5 boxes of hair extensions, 4 boxes of wigs, and various cosmetics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, hair extensions, and cosmetics

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es chofer asalariado del trufi 88; solo trabaja seis días a la semana ya que en la ciudad de La Paz hay restricción vehicular, su esposa atiende un puesto de venta, tiene una hija de ocho meses, vive en casa de sus padres donde le otorgaron dos habitaciones, el domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Pazanqueri de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinara la compra de estuco, cemento y arena que servirá para la refacción de la vivienda donde vive.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Miguel.
texts.en:
Miguel is a rickshaw driver. Because the city of La Paz has a traffic restriction ordinance he only works 6 days a week. His wife tends a sales stall and they have an 8-month-old daughter. He lives in two rooms in his parents's house which is located in the Pazanqueri area of the city of La Paz . He will use this loan to purchase stucco, cement and sand to use in refurbishing his dwelling. This is his first loan with Impro and the evaluation conducted qualifies him for loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stucco, cement and sand to refurbish his house.

loans.name: Badru's Group

texts.en: M. Badru is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is a married man with 5 children with the eldest in Senior Two, while the rest are in the primary section. He has a butcher shop that he has been running for 20 years and he is able to make profits of 70,000/= a week. He believes that with the loan, he will be able to increase this amount. He has a business plan of buying preservers for meat for his businesses with the hope that he will make more money out of it. This is his first loan with the group and he hopes that with this loan, he will be able to buy more meat for resale.

loans.use: Buying more meat for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock and sell grains

loans.name: Edson

texts.es:
Edson  tiene un puesto de venta en la zona 12 de octubre de la ciudad de El Alto donde vende celulares por detalle, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su madre. Vive en la casa de sus tíos ubicada en la Villa Tunari de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (más celulares), de esa forma podrá incrementar sus ingresos.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarlo otro préstamo solicitado por Edson.
texts.en:
Edson has a sales stall in the October 12 area of the city of El Alto where he sells mobile phones. This is his main source of income with which he supports his mother. He lives in his aunt and uncle's home located in Villa Tunari, Los Altos. He will use this loan to purchase stock (more mobile phones) thereby increasing his profits. This is his fourth loan with Impro and Edson's good repayment history permits approval of this additional loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stock for his mobile phone sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing peanuts and corn

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Greetings from U. DATIVE, Kicukiro District in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! U. is 26 years old, married with 2 children, 4 and 7. She also takes care of one other person, 21 years old.

This entrepreneur owns a small shop where she sells different kinds of products as seen in her picture, in Kicukiro market in Kigali. She has owned the business for 3 years. She works every day from till 11 pm and earns a profit of approximately 120,000 Rwandan Francs per month. With the increased profits that should result from her loan, DATIVE hopes to reinvest in her business.

This client is requesting a loan worth 500000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company s.a.

loans.use: purchasing more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María Antonia R. M. tiene la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella tiene 39 años de edad. María tiene 3 hijos, y todos estudian por el mayor sacrificio que realiza Doña María. Su negocio se dio porque ella decide vender bolsas de hielo y refrescos por lo que tuvo bastante influencia de clientes, por lo que le genero ciertas ganancias y decide invertir un poco más en este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como golosinas, jugos, refrescos, pan, detergentes, jabón entre otras cosas. Su mayor sueño es ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y proporcionarles mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia R. M. has run a small grocery store for the past 3 years. She is 39 years old and has 3 children, all of whom, thanks to Maria's great efforts, are full-time students. She began by selling bags of ice and soft drinks which generated a good client base that led to decent profits. Now she would like to invest a bit more in her store. The financing she is seeking is to purchase inventory items such as snacks, juices, soft drinks, bread, detergent, soap, etc. Her greatest dream is to offer her clients good customer service and to be able to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 25 years old and the father of one child. He makes a living running a tent-making business in the Gikomba Market in Nairobi and has applied for his first loan, for $525, to buy polythene which he will use to make tents. He hopes that this loan will help raise his income and allow him to improve his family's living standards and meet his financial obligations. One day, Bernard wants to buy a plot of land and build his own home. He describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. It recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed to make new tents

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus trabaja como mecánico automotriz, tiene un taller ubicado en su Domicio es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo cubre la  manutención de sus tres hermano menores que depende de él, Vive en alquiler ubicado en la Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la comprar una maquina scanner de movilidad para poder facilitar su trabajo y poder prestar mejor servicios a sus clientes.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarlo otro préstamo solicitado por Jesus.
texts.en:
Jesus is an auto mechanic and runs a repair shop from his home. This is his main source of income with which he supports his three younger brothers who are dependent on him. He rents his home on Villa Adela in the city of El Alto. He intends to use this loan to buy an auto engine scanner which will allow him both more ease in his tasks and to provide a better service to his clients. This is his second loan with Impro and his good repayment history qualifies him for this loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an auto engine scanner for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es comerciante de dulces, galletas y otros; tiene un puesto en la  ciudad de el Alto, su esposo es chofer asalariado, es su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que depende de ella, pues los menores todavía se encuentran estudiando y no pueden ayudar o colaborar con los quehaceres; vive en casa propia ubicada en la Zona 16 de Febrero de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (galletas, dulces) y así poder vender mas y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Elsa.
texts.en:
Elsa sells sweets, cookies, and other things. She has a stand in the city of El Alto. Her husband is a salaried chauffer. This is the source of income with which she takes care of her three children, who are dependent on her. The younger children are still studying and can’t help with the chores. She lives in her own house, located in the 16 de Febrero area in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy merchandise (cookies and sweets), so that she can sell more and can improve her income. This is her first loan with Impro. An evaluation qualified her for the approval of her loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies and sweets for her business

loans.name: Laura Maria

texts.es: Laura María M. L. tiene 45 años. Es una mujer casada y junto a su pareja tiene 4 hijos. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. Todos los días se levanta temprano ya que llegan a dejarle la leche en su casa, sus vecinos están muy complacidos por que Laura les proporciona la leche en a una distancia accesible, por lo que en algunos casos llegan personas que son de comarcas muy lejanas. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de leche, cuajada y queso. Su deseo es que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Laura María M. L. is 45 years old. She is a married woman, and she and her husband have 4 children. She sells dairy products. Every day, she wakes up early, since her customers arrive at her house to take the milk. Her neighbors are very satisfied because Laura provides the milk nearby. In some cases, people from areas farther away come for her products. The loan she is requesting is for capital to buy milk, curds and cheese. Her dream is that her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn
